dialog.text: We're really getting an engineer, Sam?
We need one, Helix.
With an engineer on board, we may finally get our starship flying again.
We almost got it flying last month.
Yes. It's a shame the parade commitee made us give their balloons back.
It's time, Helix, to admit the damage to our ship is beyond even my duct taping skills.
Of course, we did buy it used... after the explosion... and the subsequent crash landing...
But it was cheap!
And that's the important thing.
Let's see. You're here for Florence Ambrose, arriving on "The Asimov". Yes, she's here, but still in cold sleep.

dialog.action: stand there and look at him

dialog.text: Still in cold sleep? It'll be hours before they thaw her out!
Which gives us plenty of time to go through her personal effects!
Dibs on the batteries!
Can we go help the medical technicians Sam?
I don't think so, Helix. Defrosting someone from cold sleep is a job only for highly trained personnel.

dialog.action: enters [30] on the key pad of a giant microwave
dialog.text: Set Microwave timer for 30 seconds, press start...

4.place: at the same time, somewhere nearby

dialog.text: Sam, can we afford an engineer?
No, but we don't have to. She's been sent to us by a clerical error.

dialog.action: they arrive at the baggage claim

dialog.text: CLAIM]
We got lucky?

dialog.action: smiles and holds his hands behind his back, replies
dialog.text: Well, luck had less to do with it than the two cases of brandy I sent the shipping clerk.

dialog.action: sit in front of a suitcase

dialog.text: Okay, let's see what we've got.
Test equipment, clothes, brushes, data-disks, and a rawhide chew toy.
You can find out a lot about people by going through their luggage.
And it's much more fun than just asking them.

dialog.action: sit in front of the opened suitcase

dialog.text: Is it all right for us to go through Florence's luggage like this?

dialog.action: sit in front of the opened suitcase

dialog.text: Helix, this is a busy place. No one is going to mind.

dialog.action: stands behind them with folded arms, frowns
dialog.text: [DETENTION]
Okay, starport security might mind, but no one else.

dialog.action: loks around and spots something interesting
dialog.text: Helix, look over there. Have you ever seen anyone like that before?

dialog.action: throws his arms in the air and shouts out
dialog.text: DOGGY!

dialog.action: runs over to an anthropomorphic doglike woman {later known as Florence} and hugs her

dialog.text: Hmmm. I guess not.

dialog.character: Anthropomorphic Doglike Woman {later known as Florence}

dialog.action: lets go of her, holds his arms in her direction and continues to exclaim
dialog.text: DOGGY!

dialog.character: Anthropomorphic Doglike Woman {later known as Florence}
dialog.action: bows down to Helix and explains to him
dialog.text: I am not a "Doggy", I am a Bowman's Wolf, a genetically altered lifeform created by "Ecosystems Unlimited".

dialog.action: ignores what she said, continues to exclaim
dialog.text: DOGGY!

dialog.action: walks over to Helix and the Bowman's Wolf {later known as Florence}
turns around to Sam, asks him
dialog.text: His CPU doesn't pick up on all clock cycles, does it?
Hello, I'm Florence Ambrose.
Sam: You're the engineer we're supposed to meet! What are you doing in detention?

dialog.action: holds a hand to her chest, explains
dialog.text: I need to stay here until I pass quarantine. It was nice of you to come down to wait with me.
No, we're here because of *umph*!

dialog.action: has put his hands on Helix's speakers, replies to Florence
dialog.text: ->, spaceport/detention area
Okay, Ms. Ambrose. Everything checks out. You can Leave.
Thank you.
Hey! You two!
Oh. They were just waiting for me.
Why else would we be in detention?
I'd make you a list, but I don't have all night.

11.place: short time later, spaceport/outside the detention area

dialog.text: I'll be right back. I need to arrange transferring my luggage to your ship.
I like her.
She seems nice enough.
How long working for us before she runs off screaming?
I give her a week.

dialog.action: on her way notices a cat
turns away, tries to ignore the cat and resist her instinct
gives in, runs over and barks at the cat
dialog.text: RARF! RARF! RARF! RARF!

dialog.action: has the living daylights scared out of it, jumps up

dialog.text: Sometimes the call of nature is just too strong to resist.

dialog.action: have left the spaceport, walk along

dialog.text: Your stuff is being delivered tomorrow?
Yes, in the morning.
Okay. I'll need to take down the perimeter defense system.

dialog.action: takes down a sign from a nearby tree
dialog.text: [Come in! Let's talk Amway!]
Don't laugh. It works.
I know I wouldn't go any further.

14.place: short time later, on the way back to Sam's ship.

15.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: broadens his arms towards his ship
dialog.text: This is our ship. We'll give you some time to settle in.
Sam, the buswork is on fire again!
Or would you like to start right away?

dialog.action: climbs inside and looks around, sees the smoke, cables lieing around and sparks coming from some panel, replies
dialog.text: {we see the ship from outside. It's raining. We hear Sam talking inside}

16.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.text: I agree. this ship has been through some rough times.

dialog.action: place buckets where it rains in

dialog.text: But I'm pretty sure she's still spaceworthy.

17.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: inspects some hole in an interior wall, calls out
dialog.text: Sam, could you come here?
You said you had a cargo bay explosion, but this hole started in the kitchen and blew outwards.
Oh, Yes. I should warn you about that.

dialog.action: points at the hole and continues
dialog.text: If Helix asks if he can make popcorn, tell him "NO".
Got it.

18.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: explores the spacecraft, climbs down a ladder

dialog.text: I wonder what caused all this secondary damage? It seems to have occured after the explosion.
Sam and I fixed this pump.
This is going to be a tougher job than I thought.

19.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.text: You're the only Bowman's Wolf I've seen. Are there a lot of you?

dialog.action: checks someting in the one of the ships fuseboxes, replies
dialog.text: No. Including myself, there's just 14 of us.
14? That's not very many.
Tell me about it.

dialog.action: holds a hand on her chest, looks in Sam's direction, continues
dialog.text: Our gene pool's so shallow, it doesn't even have a wading section.

20.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: installs some circuit board while lieing under a control panel - belly up
goes over and starts to rub Florence's belly
is surprised, drops the circuit board she holds - her legs start to thump

dialog.text: Just curious.

21.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: walks into the room, holds his hands behind his back
points at the screen, which shows some kind of screensaver alternation
dialog.text: Sam! Florence got that thing on the control panel working!

dialog.action: walks over to the terminal, holds his hands behind his back and watches the screensaver alternation for a while
dialog.text: Wow! That looks pretty impressive.

dialog.action: stands next to him, watches too
dialog.text: Yeah!
Any idea what it does?

dialog.action: holds his hands behind his back
dialog.text: Not a clue.

21.place: later, Sam's ship/ by the secondary computer terminal

22.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: has put on a bathrobe and a nightcap, walks up to Florence and asks
dialog.text: You're still up?

dialog.action: looks tired, works on some electronics that stand and lie on the kitchen area table, answers
dialog.text: Yes. Still some work to do on the internal sensors.
I should have them working by morning.

dialog.action: also wears some 'fuzzy, three-eyed, smiling critter with antennae'-kind of slippers, stands there with his hands held behind his back, replies
dialog.text: They can wait. Go get some sleep.
But...

dialog.action: grabs Florence by her shoulders from behind and guides her towards her room, insists
dialog.text: BED! NOW! You're setting a bad example for Helix!

dialog.action: walks away, hands behind his back again, mutters to himself
dialog.text: He might start expecting me to work that hard.

22.place: late at night, Sam's ship/kitchen area

23.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: opens the refridgerator and looks inside
dialog.text: Florence can't eat ice cream! That's our entire food supply.
I thought everyone liked "quark" ice cream. I've got all three colors in all six flavors.
Poor Flo. She must be hungry.
You know, we used to have rats on this ship, but I haven't seen one in days.
Helix, I don't even want to put that two plus two together.

24.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.action: sits there and types some numbers into a calculator

dialog.text: YIP!
THRUNCH!

dialog.action: comes walking from off panel, holds up one of his arms, which has been improperly detached, with his other arm, tells Sam
dialog.text: Sam! Guess what Florence does when you pull her tail!
Being a starship captain shouldn't have to be like this.

25.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.text: How much money do we have for ship repairs, Sam?

dialog.action: gives Florence the calculator from earlier and states
dialog.text: Here.

dialog.action: looks at the little screen aghast, asks
dialog.text: This is it?
That includes the money in Helix's piggy bank.

dialog.action: lies in front of Sam, all curled up, whimmering
walks by and looks at her
dialog.text: Is she supposed to curl up and whimmer like that?
It's okay, Helix. Everyone who works for us does that eventually.

26.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.text: Well, this is normally where we lose our engineers.

dialog.action: stop in front of the screen

dialog.text: We did get some stuff fixed before she found out we're broke.
Florence is probably packing her bags right now.
Do you think she'll move like our last engineer?

dialog.action: leans to the wall and folds his arms
dialog.text: Man, that guy got out of here so fast, he left a vapor trail!

26.place: later, by the secondary computer terminal

27.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.text: You're not leaving?
I'm under contract, Sam. I'm here until it expires.
I can get reassigned if I'm in a hopeless situation, but this situation isn't hopeless.
Hey, Helix! She's staying!
This is however, the closest I've ever seen.

28.chapter: Arrival at the ship. Repairs begin. Sort of.

dialog.text: First priority. Restore power. The ship's batteries are almost drained.
Okay, now what needs to be my next highest priority?
Plumbing. Definitely plumbing.

28.place: short time later, near Sam's ship/outhouse

29.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: Florence thinks we can salvage this abandoned colony ship for the parts we need.
She says it means a lot of long hours and hard work, but we know what it REALLY means.

dialog.action: pose together ceerfully and shout out
dialog.text: ROAD TRIP!

30.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: We'll need a truck. 'Pop' has one we can borrow.
I like Pop.

dialog.action: puts the device on the table, turns around and rubs his chin, muses
dialog.text: We'll drop by his place this morning. 4 A.M. sounds good.
4 A.M.? Do you think Mr. Rivet will be up that early?

dialog.action: gets up and walks away, with his arms behind his back, answers
dialog.text: I hope not. If he's up, we won't be able to borrow the truck.

30.place: short time later, Sam's ship/kitchen area

31.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.action: walk towards a house and garage with a flatbed truck standing in front of it

dialog.text: Looks like Pop is still asleep. Now be quiet and watch where you step.
SHOP]

dialog.action: carefully sneaks over to the truck
follows Sam and looks out where he steps now too
dialog.text: Oooh. Right. If we step on one of those, we'd wake Pop up for sure.

31.place: later/that night around 4 A.M., Pop Rivit's house

32.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: Can I drive?

dialog.action: has opened the trucks hood and hotwires the truck, answers
dialog.text: No. Not after what happened last time.
I promise I'll be more careful.
Helix, you destroyed six city blocks!

dialog.action: is offended, folds his arms and turns away, replies
dialog.text: Like you haven't.
That was completely different! I had my turn signal on!

33.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: Are we done?

dialog.action: walks over to the house, replies
dialog.text: No. Pop would worry if he woke up and found his flatbed gone.

dialog.action: hits on Pop Rivit's door with his fist

dialog.text: Hey Pop! We've got your truck!

dialog.action: runs to the truck and drives away

dialog.text: That was nice of you.
Well, you've got to be considerate about the feelings of others, Helix.

dialog.action: comes running out the door cursing after them

34.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: Morning, Florence. We've got the truck and I've brought you coffee.

dialog.action: dozily props up on the mattress with one arm and takes the mug with the hand
dialog.text: Morning. Thank you, Helix.
->, Sam's ship/corridor
I suppose hot coffee would wake me up too, if I had to lap it up with my tongue.

34.place: in the morning, Sam's ship/Florence's room

35.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.action: inspects one of the gadgets Florence loads on the truck
dialog.text: Whoa. What is this?

dialog.action: puts a closed box on the flatbed and replies
dialog.text: [BIN GM]
VIRRRR
This is way cool. I've got to try it on something.
{off panel}
Hey, Helix. C'mere a minute!

36.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.action: sit down on the truck's seats
climbs onto the flatbed and holds on to the seat back

dialog.text: Before we go, has everyone taken care of business?
Oooh. Right. Thanks for reminding me.

dialog.action: gets off the truck and runs back to the ship

dialog.text: Sam, do I even want to know why a robot needs to go to the bathroom?
Uhm, no. I don't think you do.

37.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: Mozart? Chopin?
That's not traveling music!
Wolftones? Headbreak? The Gories?
Bleah. No!
Put your disks away, Florence. We'll get some REAL music going.
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer!
This is going to be a very long trip.

38.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: Z

dialog.action: finds a ball rolling around on the flatbed

dialog.text: Hey, Florence!

dialog.action: throws the ball away, off the truck
dialog.text: FETCH!

dialog.action: focuses on the ball and instinctively follows it, jumps off the truck

dialog.text: In hindsight, perhaps I should have tried that when the truck wasn't moving.

39.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: I'm sorry, Florence. How are you? Did you sprain anything?

dialog.action: runs over to her and stands in front of her with folded hands, uneasy, waits for a reply
holds the ball in her hand and droops her tail, has dirt all over her and some blades of grass in her hair, looks at Helix with flattened ears, is pretty pissed off
walks off with clenched fists, after ripping Helix's arms, legs and head off his body
walks over to Helix's scattered parts, looks after Florence stomping off the scene, is unsettled

dialog.text: It's all right, Sam. She's not hurt.

40.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: I put Helix back together while you were cleaning up. It's pretty easy.

dialog.action: has cleaned up, rubs her face with a towel she got from a trunk on the flatbed

dialog.text: It's supposed to be. All of Helix's parts are keyed, so it's almost impossible to put him together wrong.
Florence! Look! I've learned to walk on my hands!
The key word here being "almost".

40.place: some time later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/by Pop Rivit's truck

41.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: It's starting to get dark.

dialog.action: the truck had a frontal crash with a tree, one of the boxes from the flatbed lies nearby
dialog.text: Just a bit further, Florence. I always know when it's time to stop and make camp.

dialog.action: hangs face-first on the glass windshield
hangs over the glass windshield, looks around and , with a smile, tells Florence & Helix
dialog.text: Hey. This looks like a good spot.

42.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: [MR. SOLAR]

dialog.action: opens a cover on his chest, waits for her

dialog.text: There you go.
[MR. SOLAR]

42.place: short time later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/resting

43.chapter: The road trip to the abandoned colony ship gets underway.

dialog.text: How do you like your steak?
Rare.
How rare?
-short time later

dialog.action: walks away, carries her steak on a plate

dialog.text: Maybe I shouldn't have bothered getting out the grill.

43.place: short time later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/resting

dialog.action: stand there in the dark, near the edge of a canyon, stargazing

dialog.text: That's a bright star.
That's not a star. It's an ice asteroid.
They drop about one a month. It's part of the terraforming effort.
Oh.
Do you suppose it has anything to do with this large "X" we've stopped by?
RUN!

44.place: later/night-time, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/resting

dialog.text: Helix! We've camped in an asteroid drop zone!
I vote that we panic.
I also vote that we panic.
Sam, we shouldn't panic.
Two votes to one. The motion to panic has been carried. Screaming and flailing may start immediately.

45.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/resting

dialog.action: run around, scream, flail their arms, panic

dialog.text: AIEEEE!
Panic! Panic! Panic!
I'll try contacting the asteroid bureau and see if we're actually in any danger.
She's not panicking, Sam. We voted to panic.
Just not a team player, I guess.

46.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/resting

dialog.text: When in trouble, when in doubt, run in circles, scream and shout!
Sam, panicking like this isn't going to get you anywhere.
She's right, Helix!
Let's go panic in the truck!
Yea! I mean 'AIEEE'

47.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/resting

dialog.text: You're getting awfully close to the canyon edge.
No worries. I'm navigating by G.P.S.
Panic! Panic! Panic!
You are aware the Global Positioning System is only good to plus or minus 30 meters?
Plus or minus 30 meters? Why? Is that significant?

48.place: later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.text: Yip!
Yi! Yi! Yi! Yi!
Hey, I've discovered a new shortcut.

49.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.text: Sam! Do you know how close you came to getting us all killed!?
No.
But we didn't get killed, we're ahead of schedule, and we've cut miles off our trip. So everything worked out, right?
If ignorance is a bliss, then knowledge must surely be an ulcer.

50.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/near Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.text: We were never in any danger. The asteroid was dropped at a shallow angle and boiled away before impact.
All we're going to see is its condensation.
Boils off, then condenses.. That would mean...
Rain.
I would have figured it out!

51.place: short time later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/near Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.text: Captain, now we have a problem. That ice asteroid contained over 100 cubic kilometers of water.
We're now in a canyon. That means..
FLASH FLOOD! RUN FOR THE TRUCK!
He caught on quick. There may be hope for him yet.

52.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.action: helps Florence to get inside the truck

dialog.text: I think I'm going to panic.
No, no, no. No panicing. I need you to tell me what to do.
See? If you had panicked with us earlier, you wouldn't need to panic now.
Oh, hush.

53.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.text: We need to get off the canyon floor.
How much?
Three, maybe four meters.

dialog.action: drives the truck up onto a crooked tree

dialog.text: Well, whatever works, I guess.

54.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.text: Here we are, stuck in a tree in the middle of a flash flood.
Fortunately, I know just what to do in this situation.

dialog.action: gets out a fishing rod and sits down on the hood, fishing

55.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck/on a tree

dialog.text: Florence, if you're going to work with us, you've got to learn to relax.

dialog.action: the tree they're on begins to crack
dialog.text: Most problems take care of themselves, if given enough time.
CRRACK!
For instance, take the problem of how we're going to get out of this tree...

56.place: later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck/on a tree

dialog.text: The water level's gone down. We can get the truck out.
Great. Now I have to travel with someone who smells like a wet dog.
Helix, you don't even have a nose.
Someone who I suspect smells like a wet dog.

57.place: later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck/on a tree

dialog.text: Okay, Sam. Start backing down the truck.
Slowly... Slowly...
Too fast.

58.place: >,later, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck/on a tree

dialog.action: gets up from under the truck
droopy walks to the passenger seat

dialog.text: I'm beginning to learn what a crash test dummy must feel like.
Ahh, yes. Nothing like travel to broaden one's horizons.

59.place: >, on the way to the abandoned colony ship/canyon/Pop Rivit's truck

60.chapter: Arrival at the abandoned colony ship.

dialog.text: Look! You can see the remains of the colony ship. We're almost there.

dialog.action: happily stands on her seat, holding on to the windshield, wagging her tail

dialog.text: I'm just anxious for this trip to be over.
I've noticed. Your tail wagging's caused our speed to go up 10 kph.

60.place: later, near the abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

61.chapter: Arrival at the abandoned colony ship.

dialog.text: First Florence fell out of the truck. Then she disassembled you.
She blamed me just because it was my fault. How unfair.
We almost got hit by an asteroid. We drove over a cliff.
Then there was the flood, getting the truck stuck in a tree, and backing it over Florence getting it unstuck.
Man, this has been one boring trip.
Maybe going home will be better.

61.place: later, near the abandoned colony ship/by Pop Rivit's truck

62.chapter: Arrival at the abandoned colony ship.

dialog.text: Flashlight.
Check.
Chalk.
Check.
Water balloons.
Check.
You guys do know what we're looking for, right?
The dreaded derelict dwelling two ton devil bunny!
No, we're after pipes and mounting hardware, but you were close.

62.place: later, near the abandoned colony ship

63.chapter: Arrival at the abandoned colony ship.

dialog.text: Exploring this abandoned colony ship is a vital job, Helix.
It ensures no dangers lurk. It allows us to pinpoint the best salvage areas.
But most important, it keeps us from having to do any real work.

64.chapter: Arrival at the abandoned colony ship.

dialog.text: Sam, what are we going to do if we actually find a devilbunny?
That should be obvious, Helix.
We run away screaming like maniacs.
Okay. As long as we have a plan.

65.chapter: Arrival at the abandoned colony ship.

dialog.text: I see Florence. We still have a water balloon. It would be a shame for it to go to waste.
Helix, before you act, remember the words of the sage "one arm" McGint.
Oooh. Right. "never water balloon anyone who's carrying a chain saw."
Sound advice to this very day.
Hi, Florence. What are you doing?
Hello captain. Just checking the radiation levels on the ship.
There's radiation in here?
About .2 millirem. Nothing to worry about.
AAIIIEEE! RADIATION! WE'RE ALL GOING TO DIE!
Well, for some of us it's nothing to worry about.
AAAAAAAAAAAA
Sam, radiation levels this low are nothing to worry about.
AAAAAAAAAAAA
You get more exposure during a chest X-ray. Or on a cross country flight.
oooooooooooohH
AAAAAAAAAAAAA
I don't know which is worse. That you're this afraid of radiation, or that Helix had to stop to take a breath before you did.
We're not going to get anywhere if all you do is stand there screaming.
I'm going to keep screaming and you can't stop me.
That won't stop me. I don't have a sound card you can take.
You have other parts I can pull out just as easily, though they may be more difficult to put back.
Silence would seem to be the best reply.
Are you saying radiation is 100% safe?
Sam, nothing is 100% safe. Everything carries SOME risk.
Everything?
Everything.
I have a sudden urge to become a lawyer.
Don't go there, Sam.
Bottom line. How safe is a 2 millirem dose?
It's safer than driving with you across town.
Florence, standing in a burning building while blind circus midgets throw knives at you is safer than driving across town with Sam.
You're right. Bad example.
HEY!
I think a lot of the fear of radiation dates back to the Hanford Tests during the cold war.
In Washington State they released huge amounts of radioactive iodine in an effort to find russian nuclear weapon plants. People living nearby got very heavy doses.
But did it work? Did they find any russian nuclear weapon plants in Washington State?
Not a one. Apparently the whole test was a bust.
The legal dose limit for radiation exposure is 5 Rem. During the Hanford Release of the 1940's and 50's, one estimate shows people receiving thyroid doses up to 2295 Rem.
If you receive a massive dose and get sick, but are told you only received a small dose, what other conclusion could you draw other than small doses are harmful?
Why didn't the government just say how much they actually released?
Historical evidence suggests they were poopheads.
So small amounts of radiation aren't particularly harmful.
And you think why there are rumors it is harmful come from early cold war tests where people got huge radiation exposures, but were told it was a small amount?
Right.
I don't know if that's comforting or really scary.
A little of both, I should think.
Does this ship have everything we need to fix ours?
Almost. We still won't have all the electronics up and running.
Will I be able to play "Quake Nukem, Doomed Heretic in Castle Wulfenstein 3D" on the ship's computer?
Yes, your game should work fine.
Okay. As long as we have vital functions. The rest we can work out later.

74.place: >,by the abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

dialog.text: I found another motor, Helix. Will you please take it to the truck?
Oh Boy!
I was made for this kind of work. The whole purpose of my existence is to pick up heavy things, move them and then put them down.
Life must be a lot simpler when you're a robot.

76.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Florence told me to start removing pipes from the bottom and work my way up.
That's stupid. If we cut the top supports, we can get all the pipes out in one shot.
Do you think this is why Florence wanted them removed one at the time?
I'm thinking it might be.

77.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Everything seems to be all right.
You're lucky I'm around, Helix. You may have gotten yourself hurt working by yourself.
You're right, Sam. Without you, I never would have noticed this open ventilation shaft.

78.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Sam, are you okay?
Yeah, Go get help.
I didn't hear any thud. Maybe the shaft is real deep and he's still falling.
I'll ask again after I'm sure he's hit bottom.

79.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: ARF!
What's that, Helix? Sam has fallen down the old ventilation shaft?
ARF! ARF!
Things go so much faster when you speak the language.

79.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship

80.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Sam! Are you hurt?
No, but I hear hissing. I hope it's a snake.
A snake? Sam hates snakes!
Believe me, Helix. When you wear an environment suit and you hear hissing, you hope it's a snake.

80.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/ventilation shaft

81.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.action: after the ventilation shaft makes a bend into the horizontal, trips over a seam or something
and lands upside down on a mesh on the opposite side of the shaft

dialog.text: I see that wolfes, unlike cats, do not land on their feet.
I did land on my feet. I just didn't stay there very long.

82.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Where is your suit ripped?
Let's just say I'm sitting down for a reason.
Uhm... No.
This was definitely not the day to be wearing my "Teddy Bears in Space" underwear.

83.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Your helmet, that's not what you really look like, is it?
Immigration insisted I don't show my real face.
Apparently my face triggers a nurturing response in humans. They would take one look at me and immediately begin to regurgitate their last meal for me.
I can see where that would be a problem.
I mean, how do you politely say "No" to something like that?

83.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/ventilation shaft

84.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: My "face" is actually an audio animatronic. I control it with my cute little facial tentacles.
Besides, since most of my customers are human, it's handy to be able to express human emotions.
Doesn't having such a simplified face cause people to underestimate you?
Hey, no one's been able to underestimate me yet!

85.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Helix, do you have the rope?
Got it!
Okay, tie one end around a pipe, then drop the rope down to us.
More specific. When dealing with robots, I've got to be more specific.

86.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: The rope's secured. Let's go.
No. Not yet.
I can't believe I fell down a shaft for no reason. There must be something down here fate intended me to find.
Ah, Ha! See? I found a nickel!
My faith in destiny is restored.

87.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Whew. Am I glad to be out of that hole.
I'm just glad you're safe.
Aww.
Group hug! Group hug!
Helix! No! Stop!

dialog.action: they all fall down into the ventilation shaf

87.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/ventilation shaft

88.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: WAHHH! I knocked us back down the shaft! We're all going to die!
You won't die, Helix. You're a robot.
Instead, you'll be trapped down here for centuries watching as Florence's body and mine slowly putrefy and decay.
Really? COOL!
You have a very odd way of comforting someone, you know that?

88.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/ventilation shaft

89.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: One of us needs to get to the top. I see three ways we can do this.
GAHH! A big hairy spider!

dialog.action: runs up the wall of the ventilation shaf

dialog.text: ZOOM
Okay, four ways.
Is it gone?

90.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Wait. We have to go back. I dropped my nickel.
Not again.
Florence, it's a matter of honor. You don't leave money behind!
That's "You don't leave a man behind".
Thomas Jefferson is on that nickel!

90.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/ventilation shaft

91.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Ha! Florence and Helix thought I was nuts to go back after this nickel.
But despite being mad at me, I know they're going to drop the rope down to pull me out.
Yes, Sir. Any hour now.

91.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/ventilation shaft

92.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: How's the work going?
All done. Things went a lot smoother with you down the hole.
All part of being a great manager, Helix.
I know when to stay out of the way and let people do the work.
Wow! I hope that someday I'm as smart as you are!

92.place: hours later, abandoned colony ship/ventilation shaft

93.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Someone is driving up.
Ack! It's the police! DUCK!
Florence is just standing there. Why doesn't she run?
We'll need to teach her you're supposed to hide from the police.
You can do it. I'm still hurting from when I taught her to fetch.

93.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/entrance

94.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: They're talking, the policeman looks happy. Now he's leaving. Florence must have fed him quite a line.
She might even be better than you are, Sam.
No way, Helix. I am the greatest liar this world has ever seen.
When you say you're a liar, how do I know you're telling the truth?
You'll just have to trust me.

95.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: The policeman? He was just checking our salvage permits. Everything was in order.
Permits? You mean taking all this stuff is legal?
Of course it's legal. We wouldn't be doing it otherwise.
Well, nuts. That kind of takes all the fun out of it.

95.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

96.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: It was a lot of hard work, but we got what we needed. For me, this trip was a complete success.
What hard work? You spent most of your time sitting down. Florence and I did all the hard work.
Like I said, Helix. For me, this trip was a complete success.

96.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

97.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Let's go. Where's Florence?
She went to get more tie downs.
This is good enough. Why does she want more tie downs.
Sam, she's seen you drive.
I found some fifty ton test cable. If we double it up, it should be strong enough.

98.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: We can go through the canyon on our way home.
If we go south, there's a bridge.
Ahhh, what fun is that?
Sam, let's take the bridge.
Please?
Uh, sure. Bridge! Sounds great!
Amazing what you can accomplish with a polite word and a smile.

98.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

99.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: You're looking tired, Flo. When was the last time you slept?
Back on the truck, first day of the trip.
WHAT, YOU'E VE BEEN UP FOR THE LAST FOUR DAYS?! GO TO SLEEP! NOW!
Z
You've been rubbing off on her, haven't you?
No way! I had that cheap paint job fixed months ago!

100.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: She's done everything she can to help us. Works until she drops. Never a word of complaint.
Z
It's weird, Helix. I've never had anyone this dedicated to me before.
Z
Hey, what about me?!
I mean someone smart enough to know better.
Oh. All right then.

100.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

101.chapter: Fun with an open ventilation shaft.

dialog.text: Florence doesn't look comfortable.
Z
{It's a teddy bear}

dialog.action: as Helix gives the teddy bear to her, she hugs it, smiling in her sleep

dialog.text: Much better.

101.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

102.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: Sam! Look! I found a "Jet Assist Take Off" rocket!
We'll get home a lot faster using this on our truck.
[JATO]
No.
Good. Neither do I. Let's strap this baby on!

102.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

103.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: Think that'll hold?
No. Better use the whole roll of duct tape.
Where did you come up with a great idea like strapping a JATO rocket to the truck, Helix?
I read it in the "Darwin Awards".
Isn't that the award you have to be dead to win?
Yes. I guess they don't like long acceptance speeches.

103.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

104.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: The fuse is lit!
Hurry , Helix! Get in! Get in!
VOOMPH
That's 20,000 kg. of thrust. Why aren't we moving?
You need to take off the emergency brake.
Ah. Of course. How silly of me.

104.place: short time later, abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

105.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: I feel the need.
The need for speed?
No, it's more like the need for clean underwear.

105.place: short time later, near the abandoned colony ship/Pop Rivit's truck

106.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: The road seems a lot bumpier at 500 kph.
It gets better further on.
See? I told you it would get better.
Houston, we have a liftoff.

106.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

107.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: Sam, we're flying!
It's okay. I'm almost a pilot and I think this truck has air brakes.
But we told Florence we'd take the bridge over the canyon!
Oooh. Right. If she finds out we used a JATO rocket to jump it instead, we could be in real trouble.

107.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

108.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: Florence is waking up!
Quick! Smile! Maybe she won't notice anything's wrong!
blink blink
What an odd dream I'm having.

108.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

109.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: How are we going to get down?
I don't know. Guess we'd better call for help.
You have contacted Emergency Rescue Services. How may we help you?
Uhm, Hello?
What have you done now, Sam?
You call next time. They're starting to recognize my voice.

109.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

110.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: Okay, let me see if I've got this straight.
+poster in the background+
Thundebirds are GO!]
SEVICES]

110.place: at the same time, Emergency Rescue Services building

111.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.action: points at a screen showing a map with Sam's trajectory overlaid
dialog.text: All right, people, we have a situation here. What are the options?
Option one: Do nothing and let Sam smear himself across the landscape in a blazing fireball.
*looks puzzled at the ERS phone-guy
I LIKE that option!
So do I, but it would be bad for public relations. Okay, option two...

111.place: short time later, Emergency Rescue Services building

112.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.action: points at an x on the screen showing a map with Sam's trajectory overlaid
dialog.text: We can get one of the terraforming robots to catch them right about here.
If we succeed, we'll be heroes. If we fail, Sam crashes and becomes a crispy critter.

dialog.action: stands there with crossed arms, content, smiling
dialog.text: Don't you just love a win-win situation?

113.chapter: A truck, a JATO rocket, and duct tape. Three great things that go great together!

dialog.text: One of the terraforming robots, Sawtooth Rivergrinder, is coming up to catch us.
We're safe now. It's in Sawtooth's best interest that we get down safely.
We owe him money, don't we?
You know it.

113.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

114.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Hey, Sawtooth!
Greetings, Sam. Do you have my money?
No, but you can't let us crash or you'll never get any money from us.
Not true. I'm also recording this for "Worlds funniest Home Videos.".
Helix, it may be our bargaining position isn't as strong as we thought.

114.place: short time later, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

115.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: You can't just let us crash! It's in your programming or something!
You are correct, Sam. I can not idly stand by when I can easily prevent a person from coming to harm.
That's Pop Rivet's truck you're in, and I know he'd be upset, if it were damaged.

115.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

116.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: What are you doing this far south, Rivergrinder?
I got into a fight with my boss.
He called me a big dumb robot. But he doesn't call me that any more.
Now he calls me a big dumb robot who ran a river through his living room.

116.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

117.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: So what if I don't know what a cup and saucer is. I'm optimized for my job. It's not like I'm dumb or something.
You guys don't think I'm dumb, do you?
No.
No, not at all.
You're not just saying that to keep from being dropped to your imminent doom, are you?
Oh, no!
No.
No.
Not at all.

117.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/midair/Pop Rivit's truck

118.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: You're lucky I was in the area. You could have been killed!
Hopefully this experience will keep you from doing something so stupid again.
Oh, it will, it will!
{We hear the others speaking and see Florence waking up on the truck}

118.place: later, on the way back to Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

119.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: You're not going to leave us?
You owe me money. Pay it and I'll let you leave.
Hi! What's going on?
DOGGY!
I will be so glad when my species gets added to these guys data base.

119.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

120.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: So what's going on?
He won't let us leave!
He owes me money.
Do not!
Do too!
Do not!
Do too!
Do!
Don't!
Do!
Don't!
Sawtooth is an advanced model. I could never keep up an intellectual argument like that.

120.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

121.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Sam, you've made an error. You do owe Sawtooth money.
Sorry about that, it must have slipped his mind. I don't think Sam was deliberately lying to you.
She doesn't know you very well, does she?
And I hope to keep it that way as long as possible.

121.place: short time later/after Florence walked away, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

122.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Okay, maybe I do owe you money, but you still can't make me pay it.
Captain, it was tight, but we had just enough to pay Sawtooth back. I've transferred the money to his account.
Sam, you've finally hired someone I actually like.
Ethics. Of all the flaws for a crew member to have, why did it have to be ethics?

122.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

123.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Florence is so negative. She acts like debt is a bad thing.
There's an old quote. "When a man owes you a hundred dollars, you have power over him. When a man owes you a million dollars, he has power over you."
We could set city policy.
Heck, with our debt load we could set galactic policy.

123.place: short time later, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

124.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Florence and Sawtooth are getting along well.
Yeah, he's probably tellling her all about us.

124.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

125.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Heya, Sam. I was just telling Florence about the noodle incident.
The noodle incident?
You know. The one you blamed on that spiky haired boy with his stuffed tiger.
I remember that.
Helix, Shhhh!
I still can hear the kid yelling "It wasn't me, mom! It was space aliens! Honest!"

125.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

126.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Okay Sam, what's the deal?
Florence isn't the type who normally travels with you.
Florence is a first generation genetic prototype. Why do you think she's with us?
Oh, I get it! It's a stress test! They figure if she can handle you, she can handle anyone, right?

126.place: short time later, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

127.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Sam, it's been fun saving your butt, but I've got to go.
Unlike you, I've got the pressure of keeping to a schedule.
And if I'm not back to the worksite in 30 minutes, I'll be late for my break!

127.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

128.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Do you want anything in your coffee?
A little blood would be nice.
Blood?
I am a carnivore, after all.
We've got non-dairy creamer.
Please, Helix. Let's not be gross.

128.place: short time later, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

129.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: I'll be right back. I need to... uhm... use the bushes.
Ha. You should wear an environment suit like I do.
When nature calls, I can go right in my suit.
No, you can't.
That part of your suit broke when you fell down the ventilation shaft, remember?
What's the matter, boss?
I just found out why my socks feel squishy.

129.place: short time later, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

130.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Hurry, Helix! While Florence is gone, we can hide this spent JATO pack!
With nothing to see, Florence has no reason to get suspicious.
Sam, why are there no tire tracks leading up to the truck?
You were saying?

130.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

131.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Why are there no tire tracks? Well, uhm...
My teddy bear is gone! Mr. Frumpy is missing!
I WANT MY TEDDY BEAR!
I know where he is. I'll go get him.
Nice safe, Helix.
Anytime, Boss.

131.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

132.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: On the woad again! I just can't wait to put on the woad again! When you're blue, you know you've picted your friends. I just can't wait to put on the woad again!
I can't believe Florence wanted to sleep instead of singing with us.
She's still tired. That must be why she accidentally stuffed cotton in her ears.
Can she still hear us?
I think so, Helix. I can hear her whimmering every now and then.

132.place: later, on the way back to Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

133.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: We're getting close to town. It's time to play...
I know! I know! Spot the car!
That's right. If we spot a police car, we win.
How do we lose?
A police car spots us.

133.place: later/evening, on the way back to Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

134.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: I don't know why the police keep stopping me. There's no reason for it.
The last ten times they pulled you over, how often was I doing something illegal?
Ten times.
I still say statistics are a poor excuse to stop anyone.

134.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

135.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Helix, why am I even worrying about the police?
All the stuff on this trip was legally salvaged by our engineer. What have we done that's wrong?
We stole the truck to make the trip. Our engineer is kind of stolen too.
But that was almost a week ago. Surely the statute of limitations has expired by now.

135.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

136.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: Helix, we did not steal this truck. We borrowed it.
Mr. Rivet knows we have it, and we've always given it back.
True, sometimes it was at gunpoint, but we've always given it back.

136.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

137.chapter: Catch! The first appearance of Sawtooth Rivergrinder.

dialog.text: We're home!
My own room back. My stuff. No more worrying about Sam crashing into a mountain and causing bloody, fiery, annoying death.
Oh, well. Two out of three's not bad.

137.place: later/night-time, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

138.chapter: Home again. Arrival back at the ship.

dialog.text: Now that we're home, it's time to stop and unload the truck.
Most people would consider those two separate steps.
Lucky for you I'm not most people.

138.place: >, on the way back to Sam's ship/near Sam's ship/Pop Rivit's truck

139.chapter: Home again. Arrival back at the ship.

dialog.text: Sam, what happened?
I crashed into a big rock and all the stuff flew off the truck.
*sigh* Well, I suppose accidents happen. I'd better start getting this stuff inside.
Amazing. The idea you did that on purpose never entered her head.
If she weren't so naive, I'd be insulted. with the exception of pedestrians, I always hit what I aim at.

139.place: >, near Sam's ship/near Pop Rivit's truck

140.chapter: Home again. Arrival back at the ship.

dialog.text: We're home. We're unpacked. What do you want to do now?
Restore power.
Now that we have the parts, we can have the port fusion engine repaired, pressure tested, and on line by morning.
Good idea, Flo. But I was thinking more along the lines of making popcorn and watching T.V..

141.chapter: Home again. Arrival back at the ship.

dialog.text: Helix, you go help Florence with the repairs.
What are you going to do?
Me? I'm going to watch T.V. and eat popcorn.
Hey, somebody's got to keep tradition alive.

141.place: short time later, Sam's ship/Sam's room

142.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: This is going to be fun, Helix. You and I really haven't worked together before.
As well as fixing the port engine, we'll have the chance to talk and get to know each other.
I was here before you were. You're just hired help. Sam is MY friend, not yours.
Oh, yes. This is definitely going to be fun.

142.place: short time later, Sam's ship/cargo bay

143.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: You just remember who's number two in charge around here.
Before me, it was just you and Sam, right? Just a couple of guys with him in charge?
That's right.
Then it's obvious. That makes Sam the alpha male, you the beta male, and myself the alpha female.
I outrank you, Helix.
Drat. I was hoping she wasn't familiar with the chain of command.

144.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Helix, why are you acting like this? What's wrong?
Before you got here, Sam and I always watched T.V. together.
You think I'm getting between you two?
That's part of it.
And the other part?
We're repairing the coolant loop of a nuclear fusion reactor. This is women's work!

145.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Repairing a reactor is woman's work?
Yep. Sam told me so.
Really? What else does he consider woman's work?
Basically everything except for eating, fishing and driving.
How convenient for Sam.
Before you came, it was "robot's work".

146.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Sam is going to ...uhm... eat all your food! Bet you want to leave now, right?
No.
Would you like to look at Sam's computer records?
Already have.
What? You know what Sam's really like and you're still going to stay?

dialog.action: begins to take a block out of the uncovered engine hatch
dialog.text: That's right.

147.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: If you know Sam's not a good boss, why are you staying?
Helix, have you ever heard the japanese fable of "The Loyal Samurai"?
Then I haven't heard of it. I'm only familiar with classic japanese folklore.

148.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: In the fable, there was a loyal samurai whose lord was cruel and beat him.
Another lord was impressed by the samurai's loyalty and offered him a position in his house, but he refused.
"If I go with you" the samurai said, "who will take care of my master? Who would protect him and tend to his house?"
And so the loyal samurai returned to the lord who beat him.
Are you sure he wasn't just a masochist?

149.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: You're missing the point of the fable.
"The Loyal Samurai" shows us it is easy to serve a good master. The true test of loyalty comes in serving a bad one.
Oh.
So what's this got to do with Sam?
*sigh* Never mind, Helix.

150.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Wait a minute. You mean you're going to be loyal to Sam and stick to him no matter what?
Right.
Even if someone else offers you a better job or more money?
That's right.
It's when she says things like that I realize how far from human she really is.

151.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: You're staying. That means Sam and I won't be together as much.
True. There'll be some changes now that there's three of us.
I hate changes.
Would you rather fly in a ship just you and Sam repaired?
Well, I suppose change is better than blowing up on the runway.
See? This won't be so bad.

152.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Look on the bright side. You now have two friends on the ship instead of one.
You'll be my friend?
Of course.
JOY!

dialog.action: first calmly talking, then increasingly shouting
dialog.text: Helix, I like you, but if you're not off my back in two seconds, I'm going to RIP YOUR LOW BID HEAD OFF!
Give me a hug.

153.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Being loyal to Sam, would you, hypothetically speaking, help him commit an illegal act?
That would depend whether the act is for a noble and moral purpose, or if it's just for personal gain.
Oh, it's definitively the personal gain one.
Why do I feel this question isn't near as hypothetical as I hoped it would be?

154.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: To answer your question, I would never help Sam commit a crime. If I thought he was about to commit one, I would stop him.

dialog.action: stands there for a while, thinking over Florence's answer

dialog.text: You know, this is really going to put a damper on our Tuesday activity night.

155.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Helix, how can you even think about breaking the law?
He says that blind obedience to the law could result in robots supporting a tyranny. We have to decide for ourselves if a law is just or oppressive.
Sam's teaching you ethics?
No, shoplifting. But I'm sure ethics will follow real soon.

156.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Sam's teaching you to shoplift?
Yes, but I'm not very good at it.
I try, but i can't take something out of a store without paying for it.
Then Sam tried to show me how. I tackled him at the doorway.
Sigh. I've got so much more to fix here than just the ship.

157.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: I'll talk to Sam. I'm sure I can convince him that honesty is the best policy.
Poor Florence. She has no idea of the situation she's gotten herself into.
I've been told I can be very persuasive.
Poor Sam. He has no idea of the situation he's gotten himself into.
Why, most people learn after just one or two maulings.

158.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Looks into the pipe where they cut out the damaged piece*

dialog.action: tries to get his head back out of the pipe
dialog.text: I think there's something stuck in this pipe.
I was right. It's my head.

159.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Florence! I've got my head stuck in the pipe! I can't see anything!
Hold still. I'll have you free in a moment.
I'm free, but it's still not much of an improvement.

160.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: This is really stuck.
It's gone forever! I'm a headless Helix!
Even worse, the pump won't work as well because of my head loss.
No, no. I can get it out. It just needs a little mechanical persuasion.
Something tells me I'm going to have a real headache once it gets reattached.

161.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Something's wrong. I'm getting error codes. Something's not right.
Ahhh! Florence, I don't recognize you! I don't recognize anything! I've lost my memory.
No, you haven't.
See? It's right here on the floor.
Whew. What a relief.

162.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Okay, your visual memory's back in. Pre-processors are on line.
Strange. I was able to see, but nothing made any sense. I knew the patterns were there, but I couldn't recognize any. It was weird!
Sounds kind of like being at a science fiction convention.
Not THAT weird.

163.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: That's it. Now hold it perfectly still while I seal the pipe.
Helix, you're moving.
I can't help it. My actuator itches.
There. I knew you could stay perfectly still.
You are going to put my power supply back in when we finish, right?

164.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: There's not even a seam. What did you do?
The pipe's a high metal ceramic. The pipe tool's basically an induction coil.
It uses magnetic fields to heat the pipe to a molten state. Those same fields shape the metal and controll the...
Helix? Hello?
You know you've over explained something when you make a robot's eyes go glassy.

165.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: (*approx. 1160 PSI)
Ever wonder how much pressure you can take? I'll pull up the data.
No, no. You don't need to do that.
Hmm. According to your specifications, you fold like a wet sponge under any pressure at all.
It's a design flaw. I can't help it if I was build without a spine.

166.chapter: Repairs on the port fusion engine begin. How much trouble can it be to replace a section of pipe?

dialog.text: Our hydrostatic test is good. Now let's bleed down, unisolate the pressurizer, and button up the reactor compartment.

dialog.action: stands there for a while pondering what Florence just said

dialog.text: You do realize I didn't understand a word you just said?
I'm sorry. Was I speaking engineer again?

167.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.action: places a block into the uncovered engine hatch
dialog.text: That's the last of the shield blocks. Ready to start up a nuclear reactor, Helix?
BLOCK PFI]

dialog.action: slides down the ladder to the ground
runs a few hundred meters away from the ship
shouting {since she's still on the ship}
dialog.text: Okay, I'm ready!

167.place: >, outside Sam's ship/a bit away from it

168.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: Helix, what are you doing way out here?
I don't know anything about nuclear reactors, so I ran away to reach minimum safe distance.

dialog.action: they look at the ship from there for a while

dialog.text: So, what is the minimum safe distance for ignorance?
You know, I'm not really sure.

168.place: short time later, outside Sam's ship/a bit away from it

169.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: This is a good spot.
Now If we look to the east, we'll see the biggest fusion reactor in the solar system come up over those hills.
Should I be panicking about now?
If you wish. Myself, I've always enjoyed sunrises.

169.place: later/early morning, a hill near Sam's ship

170.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: You're right! The sun! It works by fusing hydrogen into helium!
But ...Nuclear power is bad. Solar power is good. But the sun is nuclear power.
And the plants! And the animals that eat the plants! They all ultimately get their energy from a nuclear source.
WHY AREN'T THERE WARNING LABELS ON THESE THINGS!
Don't shout too loud. You might start another government agency.

171.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: The sun operates by fusion. Nuclear power is what's behind solar power!
Of course! It all makes sense now!
Vampires! Have you noticed you never see a pro-nuclear vampire?
I must admit I never thought about that before.

172.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: How will we know when it's started?
We'll see our power indicators go up.
That's it? I heard about a prototype reactor that lost its plasma containment.
It made a huge bang and flash of light when it started up!
Yes. It's one of the few cases where an existing product became vaporware.

173.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: The power indicator's slowly going up. Now it's stopped. Now it's going up again.
Watching this has taught me something.
Nuclear power is really boring.
And if you intend to reach a ripe old age, that's the way you'll keep it.

174.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: Wow! A lot of controls became active now that we're off emergency power.
[CKT BKR 1A]
Pressing that button tells me to hurt you, Helix.
Oh. Okay. What's this button do?

175.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: Out! Out! I'm not going to have you in engineering trying to push every button in sight.
She's right. I don't belong in there. I'm a co-pilot.
I should be pressing buttons in the cockpit.

176.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: Attach cable B. Attach cable A. Then push.
Florence shouldn't have yanked my arm off like that. She's so exitable.
Sheeesh. You'd think she'd never seen anyone reach for the self destruct mechanism before.

177.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: So many buttons and lights and switches! I think I'll press this one.
BAMF!
Hey, a sunroof!
WHOO!
I think I've pushed enough buttons for today.

178.chapter: Power! We have power! Or how to start a fusion reactor.

dialog.text: That's the last of the grass out of your lenses.
This ship is dangerous! You can't just go around pressing buttons.
That's what I've been trying to tell you, Helix.
Well, I've learned my lesson.
You don't suppose if we put Sam in the ejection seat...?
Naw.

179.chapter: These people have got to get their priorities straight.

dialog.text: rattle rattle CLANG!
It's after noon. Florence and Helix have been working on the ship since last night.
And still no one has brought me lunch. Those two have no sense of priorities.

180.chapter: These people have got to get their priorities straight.

dialog.text: Ah, I knew I had left some coffee in here a while back.
*blows at the coffee and a small cloud rises
A little dusty, but still good.

180.place: short time later, Sam's ship/ Sam's room

181.chapter: These people have got to get their priorities straight.

dialog.text: Florence, why are you working on the truck? It's not ours.
I like to return things in the same shape as when I borrowed them.
It's also the best way to borrow items again. People are more willing to lend when they know their items will come back in good condition.
Hmm.
I've always found the best way to borrow items again is to own a good set of lock picks.

182.chapter: These people have got to get their priorities straight.

dialog.text: An interesting idea, fixing up the items you borrow.
When I borrow something, people are happy to get it back at all. If it's still in one piece, they're ecstatic.
I think I'll stick with my method. It's less work and I get the better results.
Hey, Flo! I'm going to make lunch. You want anything?
Sure. I managed to grab some food this morning. It's on the kitchen table.
She has to be kidding.

183.place: short time later, Sam's ship/kitchen area

dialog.text: Hi Sam. I brought some grass for the bunnies that Florence caught.
I'm calling them Bun-Bun and Kevin.
I think my names are much better then Florence's. She's calling them Lunch and Dinner.

184.place: short time later, Sam's ship/kitchen area

dialog.text: Helix, I think Florence caught those rabbits so she can eat them.
No, she's not.
Wolfes eat big things like elk, buffalo and talk show hosts.
Really? I always thought it was the guests on talk shows who got thrown to the wolves.
Aieeg! You're right! The red wolf DOES eat rabbits!
Sam! We've got to save the cute little bunnies!
Well, what are you waiting for?
I'm debating the wisdom of removing the only food on this ship a hungry carnivore can eat besides myself.

186.place: short time later, Sam's ship/kitchen area

dialog.text: How could Florence want to eat these guys?
Poor little bunnies who'd never hurt anybody.
CRUNCH!
YEOW!
She can have that one.
SAM!

187.place: short time later, Sam's ship/kitchen area

dialog.text: Florence is coming.
Hurry, Rabbit. Go! Run away!
No, Not that way! Go the other way! Go to the open door at the front!
Look what I found on the catwalk.
That rabbit obviously has suicidal tendencies.
WHAAA! PLEASE DON'T EAT THE BUNNIES!
Wait. Crying isn't very effective without tears, is it? Just a moment.

dialog.action: pulls the trigger of the water sprayer to sprinkle his lenses
dialog.text: WHAAA! PLEASE DON'T EAT THE BUNNIES!
spritz spritz spritz
Helix, you're scaring both the rabbit and me.

dialog.action: pulls the trigger of the water sprayer to sprinkle his lenses
dialog.text: Wah! Please don't eat the poor bunny!
spritz
Helix, I need to eat.
Would you feel any different if I was a vegetarian and ate celery? Plants want to live, too.

dialog.action: pulls the trigger of the water sprayer to sprinkle his lenses
dialog.text: Wah! Please don't eat the poor celery!
spritz spritz
I am not making a lot of progress here.
Please don't eat the bunny!
But he has a limp!
For a wolf, seeing an animal with a limp increases its desirability as food at least ten times!
Yes, sir! A limp is natures way of advertising "Come eat me!"
Bunny, we've got to get you a better health care plan.
Florence, if you're going to eat the rabbit, why is it still alive?
Because you two are here.
My owner taught me that you don't rip out the throat of a living animal in front of people. It's impolite.
I don't think I've ever heard that rule of etiquette before.
Write to "Ms. Manners". I'm sure she'll agree completely.
WAH!
Helix, predation is part of a natural cycle.
WAH!
If left unchecked, rabbits would outstrip their food supply and starve.
WAH!
..sigh.. Okay, we'll let the rabbits go.
In battles between logic and emotion, I've never seen logic win yet.
You'll see. Letting the bunnies go is the right thing to do.
RRRRRR
We'll get you something to eat soon. I can hear your tummy growling.
GRRRR
And I'm really hoping that growling is just her tummy.
RRRRRR
The bunnies are happy now. They're living free, the way nature intended.
Oh, look. There's a hawk. It's beginning its dive.
AAAAAHHHHH!
Sniff. Well at least one of the bunnies is living free, the way nature intended.
Oh, look. There's a fox.
Aieeg! They got eaten! Both bunnies got eaten! A hawk got one and a fox got the other!
WAAH!
I know, Helix. It's sad.
The rabbits are gone and I'm still hungry.
So Florence is hungry. It's not my fault. I'm sure she'll find something to eat when Helix's not around.
o/~Sam, did you know that you walk with a slight limp? o/~
We're going to a restaurant and YOU'RE paying? What did Florence say to you?
Let's just say her concerns about my health suddenly became my concerns about my health.

197.place: short time later, Sam's ship/kitchen area

dialog.text: Wow! Look at how much a hungry wolf can devour!
Ouch! Looks like we'll be going to an "All You Can Eat" buffet.
Search program running. Ah, here's one. "The Golden Trough".
It's brand new. They might not try to shoot us on sight.
Oooh. Good choice.
We're going out to eat.
Okay, just give me some time to get ready.
It's been days since I've taken care of myself. I probably don't smell right.
There's Sam's old sock pile if you need something disgusting to roll in.
Thank you, Helix, but I think it would be best if I just took a shower.

199.place: short time later, Sam's ship/Florence's room

dialog.text: Florence, you don't need to clean up just for a buffet.
Sam, I'm the only Bowman's Wolf on this planet.
As such, I'm a representative of my entire species. I need to make a good impression.
Don't you ever consider humans might be judging your species by your actions?
Hmm. That would explain all those referendums to nuke my home planet.

200.place: >, Sam's ship/on the door to Florence's room

dialog.text: I still don't have the water systems fixed. What do you do when you need to get clean?
We have a stall outside where Helix takes a bucket and dumps water on your head.
A robot to dump water on my head instead of a person. How would I survive without these modern conveniences?
This is it?
Yep. Our outdoor shower stall.
Made from the finest salvaged aluminium and state of the art mud.
Plumbing. The next thing I fix is definitely plumbing.
We even have two water temperatures. Extra cold and freezing.
You've got black stripes!
That's because your system is rated P.G.
Do you suppose the P.G. rating extends to my tactile senses as well?
Helix, I don't know. But You'd better not even think about trying to find out!
You're not used to washing outside, are you?
I was on a space station before this. Why? Am I doing something wrong?
You're missing a step.
The correct order is "lather, rinse, remove leeches, repeat".
Oh, ick!

204.place: short time later, Sam's ship/outside/shower area

dialog.text: Look. A raccoon.
Cute little guy. I wonder what he wants?
Your towel, apparently.
HEY! YOU COME BACK WITH THAT!

205.place: short time later, Sam's ship/outside/shower area

dialog.text: Come back with my towel!
Yip!

dialog.action: quickly shakes the water out of her fur, sending it flying in all directions

dialog.text: shake shake shake
Ackpht! I've been blinded!
Sometimes you have to think fast.
I can see again. Where's Florence?
Back on the ship.
Already? I didn't know she could run that fast.
So, what did she think of the leeches?
She wouldn't even try one. I told you they needed ketchup.
That was embarrassing.
I've done a lot of things as an engineer, but I have never, ever, streaked my captain before.
This is one new accomplishment that's definitely NOT going on my resume.

208.place: at the same time, Sam's ship/Florence's room

209.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.action: uses a color scanner to determine the color of her dress
dialog.text: Humans can see color. Most humans like blue, so that's the color I'll set my dress.
Your dress is now BLUE.
In college, I once used hair dye to dye myself blue. Logically, it should have worked, but friends say I just looked weird.
Sigh. It's always difficult trying to appear attractive to a sense you don't have.

210.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: You look nice.
Thank you Helix.
Oh, no need to thank me. My self preservation routine prompts me to say that whenever I see a known female in a new outfit.
I did not need to know that.
It's evolution in action. Robots who give their honest opinion tend not to survive.

210.place: short time later, Sam's ship/on the door to Florence's room

211.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: Okay, let's give your self preservation routine a real test. "Does this dress make me look fat?"
AAIIEEEE!
Screaming and running away. Not bad. I've met humans with far worse survival responses.

211.place: >, Sam's ship/on the door to Florence's room

212.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: Part of being a successful captain is crew morale. Watch me make Florence happy with a simple compliment.
You look pretty good for a dog in a dress.
That's Helix's problem. No people skills. He's not smooth like I am.

212.place: short time later, Sam's ship/cargo bay

213.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: Back up the truck. I'll shut the door once you're out.
{the truck behaves as if Sam were driving at full throttle}
SCREEECH!

dialog.action: sticks to the windshield from the inside with his face and hands
dialog.text: That's right. You worked on this truck, didn't you?
It's still a bit sluggish, don't you think?

213.place: short time later, Sam's ship/cargo bay

214.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: What did you do to this truck?
The super conductive motors and power torus had a lot of quench points. I took them out and cryo-treated them.
The rest was just minor work. Replacing seals, calibrating sensors, and fixing some problems in the optical communication harness.
It's fun to work on these old vehicles. You don't need a lot of specialized equipment like you do on the new ones.

214.place: short time later, on the way to The Golden Trough

215.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: How does a superconductor work?
Oh, it's really simple.

Electrons are half integer spin particles. In a superconductor, you get a pair of electrons to act as a single particle with integer spin properties. This electron pair now operates by the Bose-Einstein statistical model instead of the Fermi-Dirac statistical model and is no longer affected by the exclusion principle.
On the other side we see a pair of electrons circling around each other, traveling in a similar wave-like straight line.}
I learned something new. Any time Florence says "It's really simple", I'm not going to understand a word of it.

215.place: >, on the way to The Golden Trough

216.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: Sam! Look out! There's a possum on the road!
You know, we don't have to go to the restaurant.
I am NOT eating road kill.
Wah!

216.place: short time later, on the way to The Golden Trough

217.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.action: stand there and look at the restaurant
dialog.text: decaying invertebrates']
Maybe we should try someplace else.
But Florence, it's CHEAP!

217.place: short time later, The Golden Trough/outside

218.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: Run! Run! If you value your life, leave now!
enter here.]
Don't worry, Florence. I've eaten in restaurants that were given far worse reviews.

219.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.action: sees a father dragging his kid along

dialog.text: No, Daddy! Please! Not "The Golden Trough"!
I said you were going to be punished if you kept fighting with your sister.

dialog.action: entering the kitchen with two big bags

dialog.text: Can you believe the hospital was just going to throw these organs away?
I want to go back for the possum we road killed.
Too late. I've already paid.

220.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: You just don't get this whole buffet thing, do you?
Food quality doesn't matter. If you make something cheap enough, people will eat it.
I see they're all out of shredded cardboard and gravy.
Yeah. That stuff always goes fast.

220.place: short time later, The Golden Trough/dining area

221.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: Bad food buffets are an art form. Las Vegas is famous for them.
This place has the same hideous charm. The only thing it lacks is gambling.

dialog.action: points out a sign to Sam
dialog.text: is non-toxic]
Ah, good. They DO have the gambling angle covered.

222.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: Your problem is that you're a carnivore. You're picky about what you eat.
My race evolved from the noble scavenger. We prosper because we can eat almost anything.

dialog.action: takes a bite from Sam's food

dialog.text: Sam, a cockroach just took a bite of your food and died!
HA! SURVIVAL OF THE FITTEST, BABY!

223.chapter: Trip to "The Golden Trough", the finest in bad cuisine.

dialog.text: I've just come from the kitchen.
Slices her food on her plate*

dialog.action: raises her fork to take a bite of food
