1498.place: short time later, town/local dog pound/cage

dialog.text: SAM! SAM! FLORENCE IS IN THE DOG POUND!
She's out all night, doesn't check in to tell us where she's been, and now we find out she's incarcerated.
Helix, all my hard work as a role model is finally starting to pay off.

1499.place: short time later, town/park area/walking along

dialog.text: Did you see my... ah, well.
Helix, check the records. Has there ever been a jail break from the dog pound here?
No.
Florence, I know you can't hear me, but I want to thank you for the opportunity to perform yet another planetary first.
My arms!
Florence can fix that. Let's get the cover over the holes and add a little paint.
I don't want to wear a wig!
Helix, you have to be convincing if you're going to be our inside man. Now say your line.
WOOF!
Perfect. Let's go.

1501.place: some time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/cargo bay

dialog.text: Polly! You came home!
Oh, great. Well, good bye, Polly. We're off to carry out out insidious scheme.
We can't leave her outside.

dialog.character: A Voice {later known to be Qwerty}
dialog.text: These are the proper forms. Thank you. She's free to go.
[POUND]
[POUND]
[POUND]

1503.place: at the same time, town/local dog pound/cage

dialog.text: I shouldn't let this get me down. Many humans have done their best work while incarcerated.
I'm an engineer. This is a golden opportunityto work uninterrupted on ideas for a starship drive.
And I do have a little leeway. The Mayor gave me a direct order to stay here, she never said I couldn't build a fusion test reactor on the premises.

1504.place: short time later, town/local dog pound/by the cages

dialog.text: WOOF!
I am a stray dog. Please put me in the pound. Signed, a stray dog.
This way, little pup. No worries. Any dog honest enough to turn himself in is a dog I won't have any trouble getting adopted.
Woof!

1505.place: at the same time, town/local dog pound/reception area

dialog.text: Okay, I have completely lost my train of thought.
Funny how dogs will always concentrate on another dog instead of Dynamic Vacuum Theory.
Woof!

1506.place: short time later, town/local dog pound/by the cages

dialog.text: Another customer? For a day the pound is supposed to be closed, it sure is busy.
Helix, what are you doing here disguised like that?
Sam and I are here to bust you out.
Oh, wonderful.
Isn't it? And free jail breaks are just one of the perks of being part of our crew.
Qwerty, what are you doing here?
We heard Ms. Ambrose had been impounded. I came to see if I could help.
You can let her out!
I can't. The Mayor gave me a direct order to keep her here.
Okay. Were there any orders on what to do if I showed up?
Guys, my cell had locks on it! That's two more for my collection!

1508.place: short time later, town/local dog pound/by the cages

dialog.text: The robot at the dog pound called as you ordered. Sam is there now.
What!? How did he find out about that so fast?
How long will the cell hold him?
He's already out. He'll be long gone by the time we get there.
No. Wait. He's found the kibble. The kind that makes its own gravy.
That gives us ten minutes. Okay people, let's move!

1509.place: at the same time, town/city hall/Mayor's office

dialog.text: Open up, Helix. Florence needs the tools you brought.
Sam, I'm not leaving here illegally.
That's why I brought you these. Plastic copies of the original documents.
France's Declaration of the rights of man and citizen. The Magna Carta. The English and United States Bill of Rights.
I know she can get out of here physically. What she needs are the tools to break out mentally.

1510.place: short time later, town/local dog pound/by the cages

dialog.text: You're no student of terran history. How did you choose these documents?
Commnet Recommendation. They're the most popular downloads among robots looking at how humans made the transition from peasants to citizens.
I do need to talk to Ecosystems Unlimited about their robots.
That's some good writing. Just reading the titles makes her want to bust out of here.
Woof!
You want to talk to Ecosystems Unlimited? Let's go!
Sam, I appreciate what you're trying to do for me. I really do.
I can't disobey a direct order. Like it or not, the Mayor is authorized to give me commands. I have to stay here.
Now what?
Free food, a roof over our head, and running water. I've gotten us thrown out of places with less class than this.
QWERTY, GRAB A LIGHTER AND GET IN HERE!
HEY!
COMBUSTION! FLAMES... Threatening the occupants... I can... I MUST evacuate them!
You singed my tail!
You were about to sit in a dog pound all day. Someone had to light a fire under it.
Qwerty, I'll take care of this little dog. You can go home.
Yes, I can go home now.
Woof!
Sam, you're a thieving rascal who I wouldn't trust with a burnt out match, but there are times (very rare times) that I'm glad you're around.
Give me back my fingers.
Oh, sure. Try to get some compensation for a good deed and all of a sudden I'm the bad guy again.

1514.place: short time later, town/outside the local dog pound

dialog.text: Are you thinking of going back in there?
I am. Direct authorized orders cause shifts in how my brain processes serotonin. It's like a targeted Obsessive Compulsive Disorder.
Then, since you see me as your authorized and handsomely tentacled captain, I'm giving you a direct order to be free and go anyplace you please.
Woof!
Though if you do go back in, I've got a great rescue plan involving a dirigible, two ducks, and half a ton of explosives.
That did it. Thank you. Going back to the ship now.

1515.place: short time later, town/outside the local dog pound

dialog.text: Are we going back to the ship?
Not yet. If I know the Mayor, she has this place staked out and will be showing up soon.

Florence wanted to go to Ecosystems Unlimited. The planet's largest corporation, filled with easy to pocket valuables! It's a hard place to get in to. The Mayor has enough clout to pave the way for us.
She won't help us! She hates you!
Helix, one day you'll learn that the next best thing to have after a reliable ally is a predictable enemy.

1516.place: short time later, town/outside the local dog pound

dialog.text: Go! Go! We can catch Sam if we're fast!
Hup! Hup! Hup! Hup!
There's no one in the pound.
EVERYBODY, SPREAD OUT! SEARCH THE AREA!
He's on foot! He can't have gone far!

1517.place: short time later, town/outside the local dog pound

dialog.text: The ship! I can use the||YOU SHOULD NOT HAVE LEFT THE POUND||ship's account to get||WITHOUT A LICENSE!||a license.
I hate not being able||GET A LICENSE NOW!||to follow direct orders. My thoughts||GET IT NOW!||get so fractured.
And I miss things||NOW! NOW! NOW!||I otherwise would|| ||have caught.
There's a fine for||PAY FINE!||being unlicensed. Pay the.||LICENSE! NOW!||Fine. License. License. Here's the form. Fill it out. Submit... and... accepted!
I was ordered to stay in the pound until I got a license. Now I have one. Conditions met. Order completed. My brain no longer has a hook in it that's attached to a fraight train.
You'd think there'd be a carrot and stick arrangement with direct orders. Instead, the best I can ever hope for are orders that feel like being beaten with a carrot.
I want a shower. It will be nice to cool off without panting and I've walked through so much machine oil my footprints don't even smell like me anymore.
The Mayor. Sigh. Maybe she's a reasonable person when Sam's not around. For now, it's safest I avoid her.
I'll also have to talk to Abby. Tack welds are designed to hold things in place temporarily. But for clothing that actually comes off, it would be best if she used buttons.
You just mooned the Mayor!
Helix, I had to!
When she saw us waving at her after we stole the truck, her entire head turned red like a beet.
Her whole head is purple now.
Exactly. She was stuck at red. Without my help, she never would have reached the next level!

Hup!
Hup!

We left so fast... I didn't fill out the proper forms to use the truck.
Perhaps we can still get him for grand theft auto return?
Hup!
One day, I'm going to be a step ahead of that slimy space squid!
Sir! I found this envelope in the grass!
Thank you, Volunteer Mitchel. Now what's in here? Three cigars wrapped in a piece of plastic?
"Captain Sam's super secret special order 191." These are Sam's plans!
Ha! He's going to regret our finding that envelope! After all the trouble he's caused, there's no way he's getting these cigars back.

EXPLODE?! YOU CAN MAKE CIGARS EXPLODE?!

To the ship, Helix! Knowing something can be done is half the battle!

1524.place: at the same time, town/a few hundred meters off the city hall

dialog.text: Sam'sengineer wants to go to Ecosystems Unlimited. Sam doesn't want her to go. These are his plans to stop her.

I know how to check! His engineer is that doggy thing. We call it and order it to tell the truth. If it really wants to go to Ecosystems Unlimited, we ensure that it does.

Ha! If it foils Sam's plans, I'll order it to sneak THREE cases of brandy on board.
A cut behind the bow got me out of Abby's dress. I'll add a button later. Now it's time for a nice warm shower a good dinner, and a comfy bed.
INCOMMING CALL.
I'm in the...
This is the Mayor. Direct order. Come to the view screen now.
That woman is so going on my blocked caller list.
The Mayor probably wants to know why I left the dog pound. I'll co-operate and this should be over fairly quickly and painlessly.
This is a direct order. You will be silent unless my aide or I ask you a question. You will answer our questions fully and truthfully. Do you understand?
Yes.
Wouldn't it be nice if you could order people to tell the truth?
But that would take all the fun out of jury duty.
You're an artifical intelligence made by Ecosystems Unlimited, correct?
Yes.
Mentally, do you function like the other robots around here?
Yes, that's why...
I guess. Still, it seems so lifelike.
Do you want to go to Ecosystems Unlimited?
Yes.
How does Sam profit from this?
I don't see how Sam can profit from this. He's more likely to profit from the situation that may develop if I don't go.
If I give you a direct order to hurt Sam, will you do it?
NO!
Told you it couldn't be that simple.
It's dinnertime. Let's wrap this up. Can we get this thing into Ecosystems Unlimited?
Blocked. Odd. Blocked again. Ah, here we go. Medical. I can get her in for a medical check.
Good enough. You. Direct order. Report to Ecosystems Unlimited tomorrow morning at eight.
So, chinese sound good?
I believe in the Mayor's eyes, all artifical intelligence is created equal. Which explains why I feel like I've been treated as an equal to the toaster.
Do you still want to smuggle brandy on board Sam's ship?
No. I'll keep that bullet in my pistol for another time.
I don't want to push that A.I. too hard yet. As long as it follows my orders, I have an intelligence asset in Sam's camp.
Didn't he corrupt his last robot by convincing it that we don't represent it if it doesn't get to vote?
I'm telling you, if you gave that squid a gold ring, it would come back tarnished.
First, we get some cigars. Then we figure out how to make them explode.
Hi, Polly.
GRAW!
NO! BAD EMU! DON'T EAT THE CAPTAIN'S HEAD!

dialog.text: New plan. First we feed Polly. Then we can make exploding cigars.

dialog.action: stands over Sam and tries to reach Sam's face tentacles

YUM]

dialog.text: [PLAY |>]

Would you agree that it's not the Mayors intention for you to remain silent forever?
Good. Then all we need is clarification on how long she does intend for you to remain silent.
And for that we write the Mayor and ask her.
I suppose dealing with the Mayor again is better than chewing my own head off in order to escape, but not by much.
We end the letter with "Unless otherwise directed, I shall consider your orders to me to expire in 30 minutes time (nine P.M.). Sincerely, Florence Ambrose."
Never put yourself in the situation where you're waiting for someone's permission. Put them in the situation where you have permission unless they take active steps to stop you.
Or as I call it, "making human inertia work for you."
This shouldn't take long. The Mayor always answers my e-mails.

dialog.action: plays the message from the Mayor

dialog.text: SAM! IF I EVER GET MY HANDS ON YOU, I'LL RIP YOUR TENTACLES OFF AND STRANGLE YOU WITH THEM!

dialog.action: walks away happily wagging her tail

dialog.text: Sam, Tthank you. It's 9 P.M. and I can finally say that.

I'm helping her achieve independence and you act like it's a bad thing.

1548.place: some time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/kitchen area

dialog.text: This has been a very long day. My head hurts and I want to go to bed.
I had my brain hijacked by the Mayor today Twice. This never would have been a problem back home.
Back home was a civilized place where most people go their entire lives without ever seeing or talking to their elected representatives.
I have to admit that I'm fweeling a little guilty about going to Ecosystems Unlimited tomorrow.
Sam hired me to fix his ship, not to chase down problems with the planet's robots.

So after I let Ecosytems Unlimited know about the growing instability that could disrupt the planet's infrastructure and lead to a collapse of human civilisation, I'll ask if they know where I can get some good low cost spaceship parts.
Emptying out your suit?
I have to make room for new stuff, Helix.
Getting into Ecosystems Unlimited is the best looting opportunity I've had in months. There's no way I'm not going to be ready for it!
Wake up, Sam! Wake up! It's time to go!
Zzzz. Snk! Just five more hours.
Did you want to stop for breakfast?
Ecosystems Unlimited will have break rooms. I'll grab something there.
The last time we talked about these guys, they didn't seem happy about Bowman's Wolves walking around out of their control.
Back home, that's true. Here, maybe we'll get off to a good start.
At least that's what I hope.
Hope is fine, but you get better results with bribes. I recommend that we bring donuts.

You should talk to my engineer. She thinks something's funny with the robots as well.
Maybe I'll call her. What's her contact name?
Why call? She's in the lab down the hall.

Hey, I supervise her. I just don't have any idea what she's doing.

Z

1571.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/Lab 3

Z

Oh, they're very tightly controlled. You can only get them with a special dispensation from Ecosystems Unlimited, or possibly E-bay.

Z
It lets us run tests on her multiple times with slight changes in parameters. Also, if she doesn't remember what happened here, she's less likely to hunt me down and give me a wedgie.
Z

Z

Z

FINALLY! SOMEONE WHO READS MY REPORTS!

Rubber knife. I'm going to simulate attacking you. We'll find out if a Bowman's Wolf defends you or joins with a human in the attack.

Now THAT'S human!

... no matter how they got themselves into that situation, correct?
Correct.
Then it would be normal for me to fantasize about breaking into a prison and freeing everyone on death row?
Okay, time for a break.
That is an unusual A.I.
She's a person. Same as you and me. Is she going to be all right in there?
Oh, sure. With her long term memory blocked, she'll loop. As long as no outside force disturbs her, she'll happily sit in there until the drugs wear off.
I wonder if there's a bathroom around here?

1588.place: at the same time, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/Lab 3

dialog.text: Don't be silly. A.I.'s aren't people.
Really? Try saying that after you've talked to her for an hour.
I don't need to talk to her. Ecosystems Unlimited makes and sells robots and Artifical Intelligence programs. If they were people, we couldn't sell them.
Therefore, Ecosystems Unlimited does not make people. There's no profit in it.
Your logic is flawless and yet Florence remains a person.
People want lives. They want paychecks and vacations and they'll form unions to get them. People leave when somebody makes them a better offer.
That's why I say we could never sell people. Companies want loyal, hard working robots and A.I.'s.
Then why have people working here at all?
My boss says robots aren't any fun to yell at. As long as we have that, there will always be a need for human employees.
Now take your A.I. Do you pay her?
I'm going to. I just haven't gotten around to it yet.
Do you treat her well?
Of course. I mean, I did set her tail on fire once. But only once and it was for her own good.
Would you treat a human who worked for you that way?
Pretty much. Though with Florence I always leave myself a little more running room.
How is your Bowman's Wolf working for you?
Good. Are they all like her?
I'm not sure. I've only read the general files. They're all based on the same design, so I expect they're rather similar. I could see if there are any personal files on her.
Let's go!
The secret to a happy life is never pass up the opportunity to eat, sleep, or gather possible blackmail material.
A lot of red flags in the Florence Ambrose file. Alpha personality. Highly aggressive. Does not wait for instructions. Actively pursues problems.
Does not automatically recognize authority. Actively resists orders she does not understand and approve of. Routinely scores in the lowest percentiles in obedience.
As Bowman's Wolves go, I got a good one!
As Bowman's Wolves go, you got a defective one!

By eliminating the Bowman's Wolves abgility to string you up by your own intestines, you've removed them from a very important part of the political process.
Best to be properly dressed if I'm going out looking for a bathroom. The last thing I want here is to look like an escaped lab experiment.
I can smell Sam and another Human, about five minutes old. I was here too. I don't recall any of this. Has something been done to my memory?
This human is lucky I need a bathroom or I'd be hunting him down. His scent is all over me and I don't remember changing clothes!

You must be mistaken. Mr. Kornada would never come here. Getting this close to actual work makes him break out in hives.
The medical boys want data on how your hips and legs are developing. Is it true you used to walk on all fours?
It's true.
Interesting. Well, their tests are all very automatic. I'll be outside talking to you over the intercom.
Aren't you coming in?
Or aren't you allowed to?
They looked so cute in their little lead lined cages. How was I supposed to know they were radioactive mutant exploding hamsters?

1665.place: >, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/corridor/by the physiology testing room door

dialog.text: They're looking for... programmed bone groth. Abdominal muscles and internal organ support. How well the circulatory system keeps up now that I'm on my hind legs.
Ah, the joy of being a Beta Model. Only for future generations would I run like this in front of cameras on a trweadmill.
And I'm sure future generations will understand why that mechanical rabbit had to go.

1666.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/physiology testing room

dialog.text: Mr. Starfall. There's no need for you to wait any longer.
This just came through. They want your A.I. put in cold sleep as soon as were done testing. She must have tripped a warning flag or something.
Sorry. This must come as quite a surprise.
Yeah. I never thought we'd have trouble getting out of here because of something SHE did!

1667.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/corridor/by the physiology testing room door

dialog.text: Very interesting. It's Mr. Kornada who wants Florence put into cold sleep. Hold my bag, please. I've got to check some notes.
Notes are gone. Dress is gone. Everything gone. This can only mean one thing.
She found out something GOOD!

1668.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/Lab 3

dialog.text: Hi, Crickets! I bet you thought we forgot all about you.
CHIRP!
I've got a dangerous assignment for you. The risk is high and the pay is low. Some of you may not be coming back.
But succeed in this mission and when people talk about bugs in the fire detection system, you guys are going to be legendary.
Hot.
Oven.
Cold.
Ice.
Mother.
Saint Bernard.
Word association test. Did you find what you were looking for?
In a manner of speaking. By the way, can you tell me what this is?
It's a map of evacuation routes. See, in case of an emergency, we can exit here, here and here.
First rule of being a successful scavenger. Always take care of the guy who provides the free lunch.

1670.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/corridor/by the physiology testing room door

dialog.text: That's the fire alarm!
FIRE!
You have the evacuation map! Quick, let everyone know there's a fire and get them outside!
Fire?
FIRE!
It's wrong to do in a crowded theatre, but shouting fire in an office full of geeks is kind of fun.
FIRE!

1671.place: >, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/corridor/by the physiology testing room door

dialog.text: With all this confusion, it should be no problem sneaking Florence out of here.
I heard through the door. Fire. You check this floor. I'll get everyone off the second floor.
Darn it! Stop running away while I'm trying to rescue you!

1672.place: >, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/corridor/by the physiology testing room door

dialog.text: Why does she have to be so fast? Florence, I'd like to apologize for this even though you won't remember it.
Z
This thing should come with a warning label. "Do not turn off your Bowman's Wolf until she has come to a complete halt."
Z
Z
I need to move her and she's too heavy to carry. Why is there never a catapult around when you need one?
Z

1674.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/corridor

dialog.text: Now it's easy to move her about. Heck, I could even carry more stuff if I wanted to.

dialog.action: pushes Florence on the office chair back inside
dialog.text: Which means it would be criminally irresponsible not to grab more loot before getting out of here.
Z

1675.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/lab area building/corridor

dialog.text: I wish I could wake up Florence. I could carry more loot.
Z
She has funny ideas about things. If she knew what I was planning, she'd raise no end of fuss.
Z
You'd think she'd be more tolerant about sneaking property off site when some of that property is her.

dialog.action: reads a sign on the building he just passes
dialog.text: Cryogenics.
You know, Mr. Kornada wanted you in cold sleep. I think we should make it look like that's exactly what happened.
Z
Besides, Helix has been watching the ship all morning. What kind of captain would I be if I didn't get him a couple bottles of Liquid Nitrogen to play with?
Z

1677.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited premises/by the Cryogenics building

dialog.text: Z
No intruder alert. I must have grabbed the right pass card.
Z
Intruder 1586 detected in fire detection system!
Silence alarm.
Intruder 1587 detected in fire...
Silence alarm.
Intruder...
Silence alarm.

1678.place: at the same time, town/outside Ecosystems Unlimited/guards shack

dialog.text: Z
This is the place. Everything I need to make it look like Florence was put into cold sleep should be here.
Now if I only knew how any of this stuff worked.
Z
Good afternoon. Do you know how to operate cold sleep equipment?
Wurf? Uhm. Yes. It was a requirement for the emergency engineer position on the Asimov.
Great! We need to get this hot dog into cold sleep as soon as possible.
Why are we putting a hot dog into cold sleep?
Now, Florence. Let's not kill my beautiful plan with logical questions.
Step 18 of the "How to prevent cryo-injury" tutorial is done. The hot dog is ready for the cooler.
"Short term to long term memory is impaired. Follow the tutorial instructions." This is my handwriting.
Well, despite memory problems, I was able to complete the tutorial. All in all, things are going rather well.

1681.place: some time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/Cryogenics building/lab area

dialog.text: Disguise. I need a disguise. Lab coat. Cotton. Adhessives. I can work with this.
Hello. You're...
Mr. Kornada! Welcome to the cryogenics lab.
Ach! She has fainted at the sight of your magnificence.
Ah, yes. I do have that effect on people.
Z
You are?
I am... Uhm... Snart! Leonard Snart. Captain of this cold facility.
You look familiar.
My day is complete! So lofty a person as Mr. Kornada has recognized me and my work!
And such recognition will be remembered at bonus time maybe?
What are you talking about? I've never seen you before in my life.
Is this the Bowman's Wolf we're freezing or is it the clone we're sending to the Mayor?
Clone? What... Oh! A clone! Yah, yah! This is the clone we're sending to the Mayor!
No delay! I rush with her in that general direction!
Your fear of my displeasure is commendable, but first I need this one awake.
Z
There are instructions I must give her. To make sure the Mayor hears the right things.
Ah, yes. Otherwise there might be open communication between closed minds, and that always leads to trouble.
Z
I have the stuff to clear direct orders. I can make her sleep if I need to. And it would be good to know exactly what he wants the Mayor to hear.
Z
Wake up, Ms. Wolf. Mr. Kornada would like to speak to you. Try not to faint in awe of his presence.
Sorry, she's still in awe of your presence.
Actually, I'm trying to determine if I'm still dreaming or not.
This card in my wallet will show that... My Wallet...
Right here, Sir.
Thank you. this card shows that I am a newly appointed Vice President and thus have direct order authority. Will you obey my orders?
Yes, though Vice President in charge of paper clip allocation really shouldn't count.
All that matters is that I'm a Vice President, it doesn't matter of what.
Let me see your right leg. More. Mr. Snart, you have a problem.
She has a scar on her leg. She's dirty. Her muzzle looks scraped. what is this, the demo model?
Dispose of it and get another that's less scruffy looking.
So much for plan A. No worries. Plan B's are much more fun anyhow!
Mr. Cornada, I need your authorisation to get another Bowman's Wolf. People here are afraid to move without your okay.
It's a tough job being the bottleneck, but somebody has to do it.
Please put your Iris print and finger print below the red X and your tongue print below the blue X.
GAAH! THUCK! THUCK!
I've been wanting to see if that would work ever since we entered the Cryogenics Facility.
You know you can't leave him like this.
You are absolutely correct.
Z

dialog.action: pilfers Mr. Kornada's suit off him, leaving him in shirt, boxer-shorts {with hearts on them} and socks - still stuck to the pipe

1689.place: short time later, town/Ecosystems Unlimited/Cryogenics building/lab area

dialog.text: "Immediate meeting in the Cryogenics room to discuss misuse of company resources. Somebody needs a spanking." End message. Send to all.
Yes, Mr. Kornada.
[Lost & Found]
You found this wallet lying on the ground? With all this money in it? I wish everyone was as honest as you, Mr. Snart.
You don't. Trust me. You really don't.

1690.place: short time later, town/Ecosystem Unlimited/Lost and Found office

dialog.text: Guard shack ahead. I'm set. I've got a coffee pot, half a ream of paper, and three fully automatic hot glue guns.

It's too bad I can't wait. Those poor guards missed out on a beautiful, complex, and unnecessarily dangerous plan.
Z

1691.place: >, town/outside Ecosystems Unlimited/near the guards shack

dialog.text: ZZZsk! What? Where am I?
Short term to long term memory is impaired. It will wear off. If it's not morning, go back to sleep.
Three A.M. As far as an empty stomach is concerned, It's morning.

1692.place: next morning/3 A.M., spaceport/Savage Chicken/Florence's room

dialog.action: changes into her own sleeping pyjamas

dialog.text: Mr. Kornada? How did I wind up wearing Mr. Kornada's pants?

dialog.action: gets some heated food from the microwave oven

dialog.text: Run questionaire "Florrence Ambrose Baseline". Document any significant deviations from last test.

dialog.action: sits down on the bench at the table

dialog.text: You're in a desert, walking along in the sand, when all of a sudden you look down...
I feel like myself. Still, when coming back from a company that can change your mind, it's always best to make sure.

1694.place: short time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/kitchen area

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, one hand on the data slab, chopsticks held in the other hand
after evaluation, tells Florence the test's results
dialog.text: One deviation noted. Increased protectiveness towards non humans. No other significant deviations.
Hmm. Doesn't look like anything to worry about. It's probably because I've been working with Sam and Helix these past few weeks.
*has noticed Florence and the bowl of food and comes walking

dialog.action: bends her neck over the table in order to reach the bowl of food

dialog.text: However, that protectiveness does NOT extend to stinky emus trying to steal my breakfast.

1695.place: some time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/kitchen area

dialog.action: tries to reach the bowl of food
sits on the bench at the table, with flattened ears shoves Polly back with her hand, is peeved
streches her neck forward to reach the bowl of food anyway
audibly snaps her bared teeth shut in front of Polly's face

dialog.text: I'm an apex predator. I'm not about to lose my food to a creature that walks around on drumsticks!

dialog.action: having finished eating, brings Polly a bowl of food
dialog.text: Here you go, Polly. Something for you to eat as well.

dialog.action: sits on the floor, rests her head by her feet
crouches down and sets the bowl of food down near Polly, tells her
dialog.text: Now, you have to stop trying to steal my food. I know you don't mean to, but you're stirring up a lot of primal instincts*

dialog.action: sits on the floor, watches Florence interested
sits down on the floor near Polly, continues her reasoning
dialog.text: Also, if you succeed, You'll be making yourself plump at the same time as you've made me hungry. Not the best of survival strategies.

dialog.action: sits on the floor, starts eating her food

1697.place: short time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/cargo bay

dialog.action: comes walking, points at Polly's food
dialog.text: Ha! I knew I heard the sound of free food!

dialog.action: sits on the floor eating her food, gets alarmed, worries about her bowl of food
sits there with Polly, looks at Sam and wags her tail
stops and holds his arms behind gis back, smiles

dialog.text: Good morning, Captain. I... seem to be missing some memories. How did the trip to Ecosystems Unlimited go?

dialog.action: stands up, grabs her bowl of food with her beak

dialog.text: I AM SO PROUD OF YOU!
Oh, this can't be good.

dialog.action: retreats from Sam with her bowl of food in her beak

dialog.text: Did they...

dialog.action: holding his hands behind his back, stops walking and cuts her short, answering her question
dialog.text: Yes. It was an injection that kept your short term memory from being converted into long term memory.

dialog.action: peeks over to Sam, insecurely inquires
dialog.text: How long...

dialog.action: holding his hands behind his back, cuts her short again, answering her question
dialog.text: About eighteen hours. Now that you've slept, your memory should be working again.
This isn't the first time we've had this conversation, is it?

dialog.action: holding his hands behind his back, smiles as he walks along, answers
dialog.text: Not even close.
Do you remember waking up?

dialog.action: sits down on the bench at the table, answers
dialog.text: Yes.

dialog.action: closes the microwave oven, walks over to Florence
dialog.text: Great! At Ecosystems Unlimited, you found out something important. Do you remember what it was?

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, leans on her arms, answers
dialog.text: Always bring donuts.

dialog.action: walks by the table, then turns around
dialog.text: Good answer. Correct, even. But as incredible as it sounds, I believe we're after something even bigger than free donuts.

1700.place: short time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/kitchen area

dialog.action: walks back, by the table again, stops near the corner of the table, his back turned to Florence, drinks his coffee, inquires
dialog.text: What do you remember?

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, leans on her arms
dialog.text: I remember starting the psychological test, then waking up in bed.
You don't remember anything in between?

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, scratching her chin
dialog.text: Hmm. No. Nothing.

dialog.action: leans on the table with his hand
dialog.text: What about your college training? All those drunken parties must have taught you something about reconstructing a lost weekend.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, holds her hand to her chest, playfully pretends to regret
dialog.text: Sadly, I don't react well to alcohol and thus wasted all those opportunities studying.

dialog.action: walks a step, stands near the corner of the table, drinks his coffee
sits on the bench at the table, reasons
dialog.text: You were with me. Your memory wasn't blocked.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, continues her reasoning
dialog.text: If I found out something, shouldn't you know what it is?

dialog.action: walks by the table, carefully tries to gloss over the topic, meekly explains
dialog.text: You... kind of got away from us for a while.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, perplexed holds her hand with straight fingers onto her chest
dialog.text: I ran off?

dialog.action: stands near the table, embarassed turns around, scratches his head
dialog.text: No, it was more like Varroa and I took a ten minute break and when we came back forty minutes later, you were gone.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, looks at Sam

dialog.text: The guard retrieved you from the robotics building. I think you found something there.

dialog.action: walks on, gesticulates with open arms, sends some of his coffee flying
dialog.text: When we took you to a different lab for a treadmill test, all your stuff disappeared. And an order came through to put you into cold sleep.

dialog.action: stops near the corner of the table, holds the hand with the coffee mug to his chest and strikes a plucky pose, with his back to Florence
dialog.text: If it weren't for me and two thousand and one heroic crickets, you'd be a pup-sickle right now.
Why is it that whenever you try to warn a company about one of their products archieving sapience, it never goes smoothly?

dialog.action: stands by the corner of the table and holds his coffee mug, still with his back to Florence he now turns his head to the side, peers over to her
sits on the bench at the table, confused
dialog.text: There's supposed to be a five to seven year wait between cold sleeps. Did they really try to put me back when I've been out less than a month?
They did. The order came from Mr. Kornada.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, puts her hand on her chest
dialog.text: Mr. Kornada? I've met Mr. Kornada.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, gestures with her flat hand with palm to the top as if to point something out, continues
dialog.text: He didn't strike me as being the sharpest crayon in the box.

dialog.action: leans on the table with his hand, shrugs
dialog.text: True, but when you talk about damage radius, even atomic weapons pale before that of an unfettered idiot in a position of power.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, ponders her options
dialog.text: If Mr. Kornada tried to put me in cold sleep early, he violated safety regulations. We can request the site surveillance files.

dialog.action: stands near the table, interrupts her
dialog.text: Except he thinks he did it in secret.
I told him I froze you and replaced you with a clone so perfect, no one could tell the difference.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, objects
dialog.text: That... doesn't work. Even identical twins have different iris patterns.

dialog.action: stands near the table, looks away and playfully wags his finger at Florence
dialog.text: Don't tell me things like that. My stories are much more convincing when I have no idea of what's impossible.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, recapitulates
dialog.text: So as far as Mr. Kornada is concerned, I'm a secret clone. As far as everyone else, it's business as usual. Am I correct?

dialog.action: stands near the table, holds his coffee mug, affirms
dialog.text: That's about right.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, points at her head
dialog.text: I still can't remember anything. Did they say what they did to my memory?

dialog.action: stands near the table, holds his coffee mug, tells her what he remembers
dialog.text: They stopped the hippo from camping in your brain.

dialog.action: stands near the table, takes a last sip from his coffee mug and continues
dialog.text: Hippos can't be very big if they can fit in your head. I've seen videos, but earth videos always assume you know enough of what you're looking at to get a sense of scale.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, droops her head and covers her face with her hands
sits on the bench at the table, checks some data on her data slab, reads out
dialog.text: Hippocampus. Plays a role in the conversion of short term to long term memory. That lines up with what you said earlier.

dialog.action: walks over to the fridge and opens it to fetch something, then puts away his coffee mug
sits on the bench at the table, reads on, ponders
dialog.text: Hmm. It's near the olfactory cortex. Not sure if that's good or bad. It's possible some scent memory got through.

dialog.action: sits on the bench at the table, puts away the data slab and sniffs her hand
dialog.text: I still smell of yesterday. I must not have taken a shower.

dialog.action: stands near the table, chews on the food bar he just fetched from the fridge, comments
dialog.text: If that's all it takes, I could be the ships archivist.

1707.place: short time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/kitchen area

dialog.text: Tell me if you know these scents. Human. Plump. Emits gas on impact.

dialog.action: stands near the table, bites off a piece of his food bar
dialog.text: That's Varroa Jacobsoni. He was assigned to test you.
Glue. Sticky notes?
You had some notes that were stolen. Only one I can remember is "Give Varroa a wedgie."
Welding jacket. Cutting torch.

dialog.action: stands near the table, breaks off another piece of his food bar, throws it into his mouth and eats it
dialog.text: Cutting torch!? Why am I never there when you find the fun toys to play with?
Let's go outside. I need to walk away from my scent for a moment and get my nose cleared.

dialog.action: stands near the table, looks at the last piece of his food bar
stand outside the Savage Chicken's cargo bay door now

dialog.text: Okay, let's try this again.

dialog.action: pulls her sleeve all the way back, inhales through her nose while sniffing through her arms fur with it
dialog.text: SFX: SNNERRK!
Anything?

dialog.action: holds her nose in discomfort, her tail's fur stands on edge
dialog.text: Yes. I think I inhaled a bug.

1709.place: short time later, spaceport/hangar/by the Savage Chicken

dialog.action: tries again, more careful this time
dialog.text: Nothing from yesterday. It's bringing back a memory from when I was a pup.
It was at night. A neighbor was cutting up metal pipes to make a scarecrow. I still don't know why he didn't wait until morning.
We see young Florence watching from behind a tree in the background, as a human kneels in a vegetable patch, cutting metal pipes with a welding torch}
Maybe that's it! Maybe Mr. Kornada is making an unstoppable army of killer scarecrows!
Sam

1710.place: short time later, spaceport/hangar/by the Savage Chicken

dialog.action: having gone back inside, closes the cargo bay door, tells Sam
dialog.text: Trying to recover memories isn't getting us anywhere and is only getting me frustrated.

dialog.action: holds a hand to his chest, agrees with her
dialog.text: As a good spaceship captain, I recognize the wisdom of not frustrating a carnivorous engineer while she's still in her pajamas.

dialog.action: looks around, holds his arms behind his back

dialog.text: *looks away from Sam, has folded her arms frustrated

dialog.action: stand on the still raising elevator

dialog.text: Remember anything more now?

dialog.action: gets annoyed and droops her ears, holds her arms down and clenches her fists, warns Sam
dialog.text: Sam. Don't make me duct tape you to a heating coil.

dialog.action: stand on the still raising elevator
trows her hands in the air frustrated
dialog.text: We don't even know if I found out something important. I might have found out about a new flavor of fungus yummies and they wanted me in cold sleep so I wouldn't spoil the surprise.

dialog.action: stand on the still raising elevator

dialog.text: New flavor? Maybe they took my suggestion of carrion! Or week old buried raccoon!
Week old buried raccoon? That...

dialog.action: stand on the elevator, which has now come to a halt at the upper level

dialog.text: That sounds pretty good, actually.
The next time they do a taste test, we have got to get in on the same focus group.

dialog.action: walk over to the inner cargo bay door

dialog.text: As for Mr. Kornada, We'll keep our noses near the ground. But unless we pick up the scent again, I don't think it's a good use of our time to continue to pursue this.

dialog.action: opens the inner cargo bay door

dialog.text: The situation with the new moon being moved won't last forever. Now is our best chance to earn enough money to get the ship fully operational.
Mr. Kornada. Risky with great annoyance opportunities. Possibly no pay. Florence type work. Boring, safe, and so far, very good pay. No one told me being captain meant I'd have to make tough choices.

1713.place: >, spaceport/Savage Chicken/cargo bay/door to the corridor

dialog.action: holds his hands behind his back, raises his head, closes his eyes, smiles and tells her
dialog.text: When in doubt, follow the money. Okay, we'll see what jobs are available.

dialog.action: interrupts himself, points at Florence and tells her
dialog.text: You know, this is a big security flaw in your society.

dialog.action: holds his hands behind his back again, explains
dialog.text: You're all so busy earning a living, you don't have time to keep an eye on the folks who need watching.
Did I get to talk to anyone about how the robots are using Doctor Bowman's neural designs?

dialog.action: holds his hands behind his back
dialog.text: Nope. You made a good try, though.

dialog.action: droops her ears, is pretty bummed

dialog.text: Look, official channels are designed to keep people like you and me out. If you still want to talk to someone, let me arrange it.
Dare I ask how?
With a plan clever beyond comprehension. I ask around until I find out who works in robotics and then I find out what bars they hang out in.

dialog.action: looks at one of the watches on his arm
dialog.text: Four A.M. Too early for any bars that I can take you in to. Let's concentrate on getting a job and making money. Any ideas?
Several. I think the best one for us will be reaction mass refills on existing satellites.
That sounds... really boring. Exept of course, for the ever-present danger of satellites getting stuck in our cargo hold.
They're orbital manufacturing satellites. They're bigger than our ship.
Got it. Just in case of... an emergency, do we have a tow line?

dialog.action: holds his hands behind his back and inquires
dialog.text: Who do we call?
It's four in the morning. We can't call anyone yet. I'm going back to bed.
You mammals. On my world, we're as active at night as we are in the day.
That must be tough without electricity.

dialog.action: enters her room, asks over her shoulder
dialog.text: Can your kind see in the dark?
Of course not. Being able to see what you're getting into is one of the biggest killers of initiative there is.

1717.place: >, spaceport/Savage Chicken/corridor/by the door to Florence's room

dialog.text: Mr. Kornada's pants. I'll send them back in the morning. AFTER they've been washed.
URFFG! His scent is lingering like a dead weasel, only without the pleasant undertones. All right. I can counter this.
I just have to remember. The next time I see Winston, I need to have his shirt recharged.
I'll show Florence the neat stuff I stole from Ecosystems Unlimited when she wakes up.
'Course, I can't tell her I stole it. She's funny about always following the rules. Luckily, she has me as her mighty mollust mentor.
And if there's nothing else I can teach her, it's when rules are set up so that you can't win, it's time to change the game.

1719.place: at the same time, spaceport/Savage Chicken/corridor

dialog.text: a nice place to live]
[E M P]

dialog.text: Ambrose]

COCK A DOODLE DO!

dialog.action: lies headfirst on his back on the foot-stool of his armchair, looks up to Helix and Polly, comments

1721.place: some time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/Sam's room

dialog.action: still wears the speakers around her neck

No breakfast chicken for you!

I'm going to wash that man right out of my hair. I'm going to wash that man right out of my hair. I'm going to wash that man right out of my hair and send him on his way.
Bleah! His smell's in my clothes. Everything's going to have to be laundered. There are times I wish scents didn't produce such strong feelings in me.

Helix, I've been thinking about Florence's remote.
Along with the stuff that clears her Direct Order Memory, we should give her this as well.
I understand.

dialog.action: tries to take the remote away from Sam
dialog.text: It might be the batteries. Let me see!
Let go. It's not the batteries. Helix, Let got!
I heard you guys fighting. Is everything okay out here?

dialog.action: either of them pushes a button on the remote

You're jealous because I got it working again.

1725.place: >, spaceport/Savage Chicken/corridor/by the door to the bathroom

dialog.text: *having brought her over to the kitchen area, sits Florence on the seat by the table

dialog.action: has followed them, carries the remote
dialog.text: Is her memory working again?

Z

dialog.action: ponders, scratches his chin, then says with a smile
dialog.text: 'Course, it might not be COMPLETELY out of her system. She might suddenly find herself sitting at this table without any memory of how she got here.
That WOULD save us from a savage mauling.

dialog.action: proudly holds a hand to his chest
dialog.text: Well, she had a rough time at Ecosystems Unlimited yesterday. It's my job as a captain to make sure she takes it easy for a while.
Z
Okay, let's wake her up.
Z

dialog.action: seemingly pushes the remote's button, there is a noise

dialog.text: Click.

dialog.action: seemingly pushes the remote's button again a few more times, there is the same noise again and again

dialog.text: Click. Click. Click. Click.

dialog.action: gets scared and takes the remote from Helix, to try it himself
as he looks at the remote, there's that noise again

dialog.text: Click.
*looks around and finds that Helix had been the one that made the noises all along*`
Z-Z-!
Why am I... How... What happened?

dialog.action: before Sam can react, bursts out
dialog.text: Sam and I were fighting over your remote and we accidentally turned you off. We're sorry.

dialog.action: still holds the remote in his hand, turns around and points at Helix with the other hand
dialog.text: Helix, what did I say to do if you feel an outbust of honesty coming on?
If what I say is going to get us killed, don't say anything at all.

dialog.action: lays the remote on the table
dialog.text: Here's your remote.
Are you mad at us?

dialog.action: picks up the remote to have a closer look, calms down Helix
dialog.text: Not really. Everyone, and I mean everyone who has access to my remote has to see if it works at least once. It created some ...memorable... moments at college.

dialog.action: turns the remote around, looks at the other side and continues her story
dialog.text: Needless to say, had I known they hired a new security force, I never would have volunteered to drive the forklift at the graduation ceremony.

dialog.action: walks around to the long side of the table, suggests
dialog.text: Now that you have your remote, you should be able to figure out a way around it.
That would be considered an intentional violation of my safeguards.
Ecosystems Unlimited made it very clear that if I'm ever caught bypassing my safeguards, I will lose all privileges to go unescorted in public.

dialog.action: lays down on the table, on his belly, props his head with his hands and smiles at Florence
dialog.text: So, how many ways have you figured out so far?
Hypothetically speaking? Twelve.

dialog.action: having picked up the remote and turned around, sits up on the edge of the table, dangles his feet and looks at the remote
dialog.text: Very interesting. You can keep Ecosystems Unlimited from putting you to sleep.
Maybe.
If you were designing a potentially dangerous A.I., would you put in only one shutdown switch? Especially one that you let the A.I. know about?

dialog.action: lays down on the table on his back, with his legs hanging over the edge of the table, holds the remote above his chest and peers overhead at Florence
dialog.text: Are all engineers as paranoid as you?

dialog.action: puts a hand (paw?) on her chest and tells Sam
dialog.text: We call it being properly cautious.

dialog.action: having sat up again, throws the remote over his shoulder
dialog.text: Here. Let me show you something else I picked up.

dialog.action: pulls the small flask of 'direct order memory factory reset'-stuff he stole from Ecosystems Unlimited out of his sleeve, puts it on the table in front of Florence
dialog.text: It's a factory reset. You sniff it and it erases any direct orders your evil human overlords may have given you.
Humans aren't evil overlords.
Accounting department.

dialog.action: puts down the remote, adjusts her statement
dialog.text: Most humans aren't evil overlords!

dialog.action: leaves the remote and the 'direct order memory factory reset'-stuff with Florence and runs off

dialog.text: Don't you want to keep these?

dialog.action: calls over his shoulder as he runs off
dialog.text: Heck, no. With great power comes great responsibility, and who want's that?
I probably shouldn't have these. Especially this remote.
Still, me having them rather than someone else greatly increases my chances of making it through a shower uninterrupted.

dialog.action: stores the 'direct order memory factory reset'-stuff and her remote in her night table
still wearing the speakers around her neck, sneaks up behind Florence
stands behind Florence when suddenly the speakers around her neck play a loud noise

dialog.text: *almost jumps to the ceiling as the sound scares the living daylight out of her unsuspecting self

dialog.action: runs by Helix and Sam, fleeing the angry Florence
still holds the microphone belonging to Polly's speakers

dialog.text: Can our Road Runner outrun our Coyote?

dialog.action: turns to run away, after Polly
dialog.text: You fool! She's just trying to outrun us!

1734.place: very short time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/corridor

dialog.action: run out of the cargo bay door

dialog.text: RUN AWAY! RUN AWAY!

dialog.action: looks after them from the cargo bay door, decides to stay inside

dialog.text: Security protocol recognized. Ship lockdown in progress.

dialog.action: have walked back, stand near the cargo bay door and look at it

dialog.text: You can get us back in, right?
Helix, a word of advice. Never pick the lock of a door that's protecting you from a beating.
Continue lockdown and hold calls for twenty minutes. Then cancel lockdown, accept calls, and open the rear cargo door.
Understood.
I have the ship to myself. For the next twenty minutes, there's effectively zero chance that anyone will disturb me or see me.

dialog.action: comes out of her room, carrying it in her jaw like a trophy
dialog.text: Which means I can finally take a shower with my rubber duck squeaky toy.

1736.place: short time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/Florence's room

dialog.action: removes her pajamas' trousers, bracing herself on the shower door, holding the towel and the rubber duck squeaky toy in front of her
dialog.text: Computer, music please. Florence playlist one.

dialog.action: puts away the towel and steps into the shower, selects settings for the water and rhythmically chomps the rubber duck squeaky toy to the music

dialog.text: Squeak. Squa, squeak. Squa, squeak, squa, squeak, squa,squeak.
If humans had the jaw muscles for it, they's realize the squeaky toy is the perfect musical accompaniment for Mozart in the shower.
That takes care of yesterday. Back to being a clean slate again.
Humans don't have a lot of scent/memory integration. They don't really seem to get that part of canine memory is carried externally.
It caused problems when I was a pup. I hated baths. My owner thought he was getting me clean. From my point of view, he was erasing all my notes.
It was nice to finally have an uninterrupted shower. The next time I lock down the ship, I'm doing it for an hour.

dialog.action: run by the surprised Florence in a hurry

dialog.text: Secure the hatches! Turn off the lights! Nobody's home! And don't answer the door or the phone!
Though with practice, I could probably get my shower time down to five minutes.

1739.place: short time later, spaceport/Savage Chicken/cargo bay

dialog.text: All that fuss over a few crumbs of bread to feed a starving bird.
It was five loaves.
I asked if I could have them.
After you were already running.
Polly is fed and we helped a baker improve his throwing arm.
I'm going to tell the baseball team. They'd be interested in a man who can leave a bruise with a muffin.

dialog.action: stops, holds his arms behind his back and looks around
dialog.text: Time for you guys to get to work. Ship, where's Florence?
{meanwhile}
She's probably walking back along our scent trail.
That will lead her to the angry baker!

dialog.action: starts running to the exit, presumably after Florence
dialog.text: It would be so much safer for us if Florence could keep her nose out of our business.
Especially when that nose is so closely followed by big, sharp, pointy teeth.

dialog.action: run out of the cargo bay

dialog.text: Run! Run! We don't know how much of a lead she's got!
If Florence makes it to the angry baker before we do, our goose is cooked!
Now where are those two headed in such a hurry? An emergency? I better follow and find out.

1742.place: at the same time, spaceport/hangar/by the side of the Savage Chicken

dialog.action: after having refitting the hand-scanner pad's cover, walks around to the back of the ship

dialog.text: First my boss tells me to secure the ship, then he runs off and leaves the door open.
I'm beginning to understand what a network administrator goes through.

1743.place: >, spaceport/hangar/by the cargo bay door of the Savage Chicken

dialog.text: We better have a plan or we're going to wind up face down in the turnovers.
I'm sure I'll have one before we get there, Helix.
Besides, the baker is cheap. That french bread he was using came form the discount bin.
But mark my words! One day, I'm going to be so famous that I get beaten with freshly baked goods and not just the day olds!

1744.place: at the same time, near the town/on the way to the bakery

dialog.text: The ship's secure. Now to chase down Sam and Helix.
Sam's scent is so unique, I could track him through an open perfume factory in a thunderstorm.
The down side is that if I'm not careful and get a nose full of him, my food tastes funny the rest of the day.

1745.place: >, spaceport/by the door of the hangar the Savage Chicken parks in/on the way after Sam & Helix

dialog.action: looks at the bakery up ahead
dialog.text: The doors aren't barricaded. We got here brefore the bakery was fortified.
Florence spotted! Coming up fast!
Quick! Inside! Our plan is not to get killed!
That's not a very good plan.
It's a great plan when you consider the alternative!

dialog.action: run into the bakery through the open front door

1746.place: >, near the town/by the bakery's door

dialog.text: Now what?
Desperate times call for desperate measures.

dialog.action: lays some bank notes on the counter
dialog.text: Hi. I left this morning without paying. Here you go.

dialog.action: looks back at the Baker and smiles

dialog.text: SAM'S GONE MAD! MAD SQUID!
RUN! RUN WHILE YOU CAN!
Being honest is more fun than I thought.
He's running from me.
MAD SQUID!

dialog.action: holds a hand to his chest
dialog.text: Here I am, trying to do the right thing, and the baker is running from me.

dialog.action: picks up the bank notes and runs after the Baker, with a smile on his face
dialog.text: I could never forgive myself if I missed an opportunity like this.
There's a horrible creature after the baker!
WHO'LL MAKE OUR LICHEN BREAD NOW?
Sam. And if it's not Sam, I need to help the baker.
You left the door open! Now there are two horrible creatures after the baker!
Maybe he left a cook book?

1749.place: >, near the town/by the bakery's door/

dialog.text: We can't stand out here while the bakery is being attacked!
We need a mob. Do you have torches and pitchforks?
The baker! He has toothpicks for free samples! The plastic end will burn!
And the other end IS pointy.
Shouldn't we get more people?

dialog.action: replies while lighting two toothpicks as mini-torches
dialog.text: No time. Besides, compact mobs are all the rage these days.

1750.place: short time later, near the town/bakery/sales room

dialog.text: Take the money!

dialog.action: keeps fleeing, waving his arms about
dialog.text: No! If you want to give it away, there's something wrong with it!

dialog.action: keeps fleeing, waving his arms about
dialog.text: It's counterfeit! It's been licked by a cat! It's radioactive!

dialog.action: keeps fleeing, waving his arms about, runs out of the bakery's back door
dialog.text: You covered it with squid germs! It's stolen from the Mafia! Get it away from me!
This guy's a treasure trove of good ideas. Helix, I hope you're writing these down.

dialog.action: follows the Baker & Sam & Helix out the bakery's back door, runs on all fours

dialog.text: Sam & Helix: *chase after him*

dialog.action: stands up and looks ahead, sees the Baker & Sam & Helix run into the nearby building, reads what's written on it
dialog.text: Strategic Pie Reserve]
I do not see this ending well.

1752.place: short time later, near the town/bakery/kitchen/back door

dialog.action: runs after the Baker & Sam & Helix
hold their mini torches, look ahead and see Florence run into the nearby building, read what's written on it
dialog.text: Strategic Pie Reserve]
Pies! The only thing more dangerous than a french ninja is a french ninja with a pie!
Ninja? Aren't you guys supposed to remain unseen?
The Sous-Sensei allows us time off while shopping.
But the art of invisibility...
Kind of works against you when the baker calls your ticket number.

1753.place: >, near the town/near the bakery/on the way to the E.P.W. 3

dialog.action: flees through the E.P.W. 3 in panic, waving his arms about

dialog.text: Welcome to the Strategic Pie Warehouse. Pies for your every need.

dialog.action: points out to Helix, where the Baker went, still holds his bank notes in his hand

dialog.text: To access, please stand near any vendo-matic machine and request the number and type of pie desired.

dialog.action: on all fours, comes running in through the front door

dialog.text: The Strategic Pie Warehouse holds enough pies to feed 50,000 people for three years. In case of planetary ecosystem collapse, please keep this fun fact in mind before resorting to cannibalism.

1754.place: at the same time, near the town/E.P.W. 3

dialog.text: They can't be far ahead. With luck, perhaps I can stop this before pies start flying.
{zoom out}

dialog.action: runs on all fours through the rows of pie lockers in the E.P.W. 3

dialog.text: Enjoy your meal. With the activation of the Strategic Pie Warehouse, emergency services have been notified and are on their way.
They can't be far ahead. With luck, perhaps I can stop this before half the city is involved.
Stay back! I'm armed with a pie!
Egads! An imbalance of power!

dialog.action: hurries to the nearest pie locker, orders
dialog.text: Pie! One! Algae and Lichen Swirl! Delivery speed! As fast as possible!
Thank you, sir. Enjoy your meal.

dialog.action: is hit by the pie, splays his hands and the bank notes fall to the floor
wander around between the pie lockers, still holding their mini-torches
as he hears the E.P.W. 3 A.I.'s announcement, strikes a dramatic pose
dialog.text: It's begun! A pie has been requested! We must arm ourselves for the upcoming battle!

dialog.action: goes over to one of the pie lockers, orders
dialog.text: Two pies! Paramedicum Parfait and Amoebae Ripple.

dialog.action: having both taken one of the pies out of the locker, they walk on, still holding their mini-torches

dialog.text: You know, the temptation to use this thing is awful.
I know. Let's find some targets besides each other fast!

dialog.action: comes running on all fours towards Sam & Helix & the Baker
Sam's bank notes lie by his feet
dialog.text: {meanwhile}

dialog.action: opens a pie locker to get some more pies
waits, with the pie in his hand
removes some pie from his face
dialog.text: Florence, grab a pie and join the good fight!
I can't.
Why not?
I ran over here on all fours. I can't throw a pie without washing my hands first. It would be unsanitary.

1758.place: at the same time, near the town/E.P.W. 3

dialog.action: still waits, with the pie in his hand

dialog.text: Before we start throwing pies, what is the problem here?
I sort of neglected to give the baker any money this morning.

dialog.action: holds the bank notes out to the baker
dialog.text: Now that I've come back, he's not accepting it.
If Sam's trying to give away money, there's something wrong with it!

dialog.action: sniffs the bank notes Sam is holding out

dialog.text: Sniff Sniff
YUCK!
Oh, sure. Take the human's side.
You can't give that money to the baker. It's disgusting.

dialog.action: stuffs the bank notes back into his suit
dialog.text: Money is never disgusting. But I shall follow your advice and keep these bills close to my heart.
And you. How many pies would we have to throw until we do more damage than what Sam owes you?
Let's see. With the cost of pies... Two.
Then wouldn't it make sense to stop now before we go deeper into debt?
Florence. Financial responsibility has no place in a pie fight!
We're not even! He stole from me! And I'm losing money by being away from my shop.
I understand. By having a pie fight instead of delivering reaction mass, we're losing a bundle as well.
We're losing money by being here?
We're losing A LOT of money by being here.

dialog.action: throws the pie he holds up in the air, runs over to the Baker and hugs him, wails
dialog.text: Mr. Baker Sir! My most sincere apologies. What can I do to make this right?
Let go of my wallet or pies start flying here and now!

dialog.action: as it comes down again, catches the pie Sam threw up in the air

dialog.text: We've lost the baker. We're also kind of lost ourselves.
{in the background}
{in the foreground}
POLO!

dialog.action: looks at the French Ninja depreciatively

dialog.text: Hey, if it's a stupid idea and it works, then it isn't stupid.
HA!
Ah, heck. It's just one of the warehouse robots.

dialog.action: walks around the corner and looks at Helix
has a stack of three pies standing by his feet and two more in his hands, looks at the Fench Ninja and the Random Customer 1
trows a pie at each of them and flees with the other three pies
stands there with a pie in his face
dialog.text: Didn't see that coming.

dialog.action: also stands there with a pie in his face
dialog.text: After we rescue the baker, I intend to have a word with their programmers.
Sam! Sam! There's people here trying to rescue the baker!
That shouldn't be a problem.
We've been able to come to an agreement.
Oh.
Then I guess I shouldn't have hit them with pies.
Just like back home. By the time you've finished with negotiations, your allies have already started a shooting war.

dialog.action: hold pies, look in the direction Helix just came from

dialog.text: We need to talk to the bakers rescuers.
No. They've been hit. They're not going to talk. They're coming in with pies blazing.
Then we have to accept responsibility for Helix's actions.
Again, no. We've inflicted harm, upon the enemy. Rules of war state we may now cowardly run away and still maintain honor.
SURRENDER OR PIE!
Hello. Can we talk about this?
PIE!

dialog.action: stands behind Florence and therefore gets hit by the pie

dialog.text: That's it. My next engineer has got to have slower reflexes.

1766.place: short time later, near the town/E.P.W. 3

dialog.action: removes the pie pan from his face
gets poised to ward off any thrown pies
watches, stands behind the French Ninja
dialog.text: Out of the way, Florence. We've passed the point for talk.

dialog.action: vigorously throws away the now empty pie pan in the general direction of the French Ninja
dialog.text: This must now be settled with sweat, terror, and cherry filling.
*runs after the flying pie pan
Did we just lose our heavy hitter because of a thrown pie pan?
On the plus side, she did take out the guy with the ninja while chasing it.
Excuse me. These two did come to rescue me. It would be ungrateful not to side with them.
You could claim the Stockholm Syndrome and side with us.

dialog.action: hands two new pies to the French Ninja
has lost his mini-torch, takes the pies
has lost his mini-torch, lies on the floor

dialog.text: The Stockholm Syndrome has only been proven with human captors, not robots or alien squids.

dialog.action: holds the wallet out to the Baker
dialog.text: Let me sweeten the deal. I'll give you your wallet back. Minus the money I found inside, of course.

dialog.action: disgruntedly throws his pie at Sam's face

dialog.text: {zoom out}

dialog.action: stands there with folded arms, watches the pie plate roll and Florence run by
chases the empty pie plate on all 'fours', while she still carries the pie in one hand

dialog.character: Policeman with black gloves {later known to be a robot}
dialog.text: Hup!

dialog.action: still carries the pie, goes over to the Mayor's Assistant and carefully inquires
dialog.text: Is the use of a pie still an accepted method of disagreeing with the policies of an established political party?
Why, yes. I believe it is.
I disagree highly with your policies on artifical intelligence!
Hey! You can't do that and run off! You have to fill out a form!

dialog.action: has removed most of the pie from his face, now leafs through his digital notepad
dialog.text: {meanwhile}

dialog.character: Policeman with black gloves {later known to be a robot}
dialog.text: *throws a pie in his direction

dialog.action: gets hit in the face by the pie

dialog.character: Policeman with black gloves {later known to be a robot}
dialog.text: I also disagree with your established policies on artifical intelligence.

dialog.character: Policeman with white gloves {later known to be a robot}
dialog.action: waits behind the Policeman with black gloves {later known to be a robot} with a pie in his hands
confused, looks over to the policeman with black gloves
dialog.text: What? Why?

dialog.character: Policeman with black gloves {later known to be a robot}
dialog.action: takes of his helmet, revealing a robot-head

dialog.character: Policeman with white gloves {later known to be a robot}
dialog.action: raises his pie and strikes out

dialog.text: Oh, My. I'm going to be seeing a lot of pies in the next few seconds, aren't I?

1770.place: short time later, near the town/E.P.W. 3

dialog.action: aims at the Mayor's Assistant with the pie he holds

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: That's enough.

dialog.action: rubs some pie off his face

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.action: explains why he shouldn't throw the pie
dialog.text: He's been hit with a pie twice for the same complaint. He get's it. Further pies would be redundant.

dialog.action: @ Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: I've been programmed for tripple redundancy, Sir.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Rookie, you just bought yourself sixty four hours on Spam Patrol.

dialog.action: removes the pie from his face
dialog.text: What are robots doing in our police force?

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow} & Robot Policeman with black gloves
dialog.text: TO PROTECT AND SERVE.
Are there a lot of robots like this?

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: No, Sir. Every robot here is from factory one and all over twenty one years old.
Twenty one years old.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Age of consent, Sir. I wouldn't want to be accused of robbing the parts bin.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.action: directs the Robot Policeman with black gloves to go and observe the other subjects in the E.W.P. 3

dialog.text: Ecosystems Unlimited told us robots went to the scrap yard when they turned eighteen. They said there were problems with stability beyond that point.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.action: follows the Robot Policeman with black gloves

dialog.text: These guys are older than eighteen and they're not acting like robots. They're acting like... people.

dialog.character: Robot Policeman {later known to have a box-head, two eye-lenses}
dialog.action: walks around the corner of the nearest pie locker with a pie in his hands, looks at the Mayor's Assistant

dialog.text: Which means, from a control point of view, they really have gone unstable.

dialog.action: comes running back to the others
dialog.text: Sam! Sam! The Mayor's assistant is here! With the police!

dialog.action: throws a pie at the Random Customer 1, then looks at her
dialog.text: {meanwhile}

dialog.action: is hit by the pie Sam just threw
stands there with a pie in his face
hides behind the baker, with a pie in his hand, ready to throw
looks at one of the thrown pies that now lie face down on the floor
stands near Sam, insecurely waits for a response
looks around, pondering, then talking to himself
dialog.text: That means the Mayor can't be far behind.

dialog.action: stands nearby, wipes the pie off his face, while he listens to Sam

dialog.text: We're running, right?
I was thinking more along the lines of an ambush.
Red Shirt Guy, intercept incoming pies.

dialog.action: folds his arms and doesn't move
stand by the baker and don't move either

dialog.text: Sam, you're a scoundrell. We're not going to help you.

dialog.action: assumes a honorable pose, his hand on his chest
dialog.text: Scoundrel or not, this is your chance to stand against oppression. To throw the pies of justice into the face of tyranny! To let them know that people should not fear the government, government should fear the people!
Do you really expect us to buy that load of hogwash?
No. I just needed to delay you long enough so that running was no longer an option.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow} & Robot Policeman with black gloves
dialog.action: a pie flies by on the other side of the pie locker

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.action: walks over to the Robot Policeman with black gloves
dialog.text: What's our tactical situation?

dialog.action: more pies fly by on the other side of the pie locker
dialog.text: There are five pie throwers and one non combatant. If we move now, we'll get creamed.

dialog.action: turns to the Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow} and folds his arms
dialog.text: I suggest we wait. Pies are being used at 20 times production rate. With given inventory, they'll run out of ammunition in 2406 years.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.action: takes a pie out of the pie locker they hide behind
dialog.text: There are five of us. What if we throw pies back?
Pie inventory will be exausted in only 1203 years! Sir, you're a genius!
Florence, this is a pie fight. You're not throwing any pies. Get in the game!

dialog.action: a thrown pie flies by, other already thrown pies lie on the floor
dialog.text: {in the foreground}

dialog.action: throws a pie back at the others
dialog.text: {in the background}

dialog.action: gets some more pies from a pie locker
hands Florence one of the pies he holds and gets the other one ready to throw
dialog.text: Work. Work. Work. There's always going to be work. When you're done, there's more work. But an opportunity like this? Why, I'd never forgive myself if I let it pass you by.
SAM...

dialog.action: a thrown pie flies by from where the others are
dialog.text: Good! Now take that outrage and channel it through a pie! Preferably at those guys.
There's a target! Throw!

dialog.action: looks in the direction Sam points out
dialog.text: That's a police officer! I can't thow a pie at a police officer!
There's the Mayor's Assistant! Get him! Get him!

dialog.action: shakes some pie pieces off her free hand
dialog.text: That would be redundant.
Ah, waiting for the Mayor herself, eh?

dialog.action: bashfully looks down at the pie she holds
dialog.text: WHAT?! NO! No. Maybe.
I would... very much... like to hit the Mayor with a pie. But what I want to do and need to do aren't the same thing.
These aren't our pies. I need to apologize to the Mayor's Assistant and take responsibility for what happened here.

dialog.action: comes from the other side, sees Sam and approaches him from behind
dialog.text: Sam Starfall. I knew you'd be in the middle of this.
WHERE WERE YOU THIRTY SECONDS AGO?
Sam, I'm going to...

dialog.action: hands her the pie he was holding
dialog.text: Hit me with a pie? Well, I suppose even the Mayor deserves some fun now and then. Here you go.
What? Waiting for an engraved invitation? Fine. Here you go. This is a direct order. Hit me with a pie.
This is a trick, isn't it?
Now what did I do?

dialog.action: comes over to them as requested
shows him the pie Sam handed her
dialog.text: He handed me this and said...
I'M HENRY ThE EIGHTH, I AM. HENRY THE EIGHTH, I AM, I AM.

dialog.action: turns her head to Sam (and all the others in the background) and, to overcome the singing, talks rather loud as she continues
dialog.text: THIS IS A DIRECT ORDER! HIT ME WITH A PIE!

dialog.action: naturally heard her and now look in her direction

dialog.text: I hate you, Sam. I hate you more than any woman's ever hated a cephalopod.
{we see:}
I hit the Mayor! I hit the Mayor with a pie!
{zoom out, we see:}

dialog.character: Baker & Helix & Sam & Florence & French Ninja {& Random Customer 1}

dialog.text: I didn't have to. I could have asked her to clarify. Still, a direct order to do something I wanted to do! POW! It felt so... so right!
I'm going back. I think I can pie her of my own free will now.
Keep running, Florence. There's a difference between savoring a victory and choking on it.

1781.place: short time later, near the town/E.P.W. 3

dialog.text: That worked better than I expected. The police joined in and you're happy about being able to follow a direct order.
{zoom out, we see:}

dialog.character: Baker & Helix & Sam & Florence & French Ninja & Random Customer 1

dialog.text: With the chimps, they set up a positive feedback loop by releasing dopamine into the mesolimbic pathway when they completed an order. When they were given orders they liked, it led to addiction problems.
You just lost your happy, didn't you?
Which means... negative feedback. Yes! Now that I'm unhappy I can be happy again!

dialog.action: blocks the others from running outside
dialog.text: Wait! Wait! There's one final note yet to be played.
You stole the Mayor's cigar?

dialog.action: a resounding noise rolls through the E.P.W. 3
dialog.text: Not stole. Substituted.
{off panel}
SAM!
No sense of theatre. Why, if I weren't here, you guys would have left the stage before the fat lady sung.

1783.place: >, near the town/by the back door of the E.P.W. 3

dialog.text: THAT ROTTEN LITTLE SPACE MOLLUSK! I'LL TEACH HIM TO HIT ME WITH A PIE!

I'll rip his tentacles off! I'll boil him in pudding and drive a stake of mistletoe though his heart! I'll have him tied to a post and forced to attend every single budget meeting for the next century!
Ma'am? Sam never hit you with a pie.
Now I'm really going to kill him! How dare he get me this mad and then be innocent of what I'm accusing him of?!

1784.place: short time later, near the town/E.P.W. 3

dialog.text: I'm going to get cleaned up. The next time I see you, I want a good explanation on why my own police force hit me with pies!

dialog.character: Robot Policeman with black gloves & Robot Policeman {box-head, two eye-lenses} & Mayor's Assistant
Robot Policeman with black gloves & Robot Policeman {box-head, two eye-lenses}

dialog.text: Would you like me to fill out a bug report, Sir?
I am so fired.
What am I supposed to tell the Mayor?
Tell her the truth.
We are being trained as a police force to help solve conflicts among the planet's non-human population.
Our non-human population consists of one person. Sam. Do we really need an entire police force for one alien squid?
{meanwhile}
You're a robot police force? I mean, I know you're robots. What I mean is you're a police force for other robots?
Yes Sir. That is what we are being trained for.
Why? You can't commit crimes against a robot. They don't have any rights.
{meanwhile}

dialog.action: clean the area from the remains of the pie fight, minding their own business

dialog.text: I think we have rights.
Are you sure?
Look, there's an easy way to settle this. Do either of you have a copy of your owners manual?

dialog.action: turns to the Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Chief, do robots have rights?

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: As far as we're concerned, they do.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Part of the law and order is respecting the rights of others. We're not going to make the same Mistake as the Pinkertons did when labor tried to organize.
I guess it is better to learn from the mistakes of others rather than to make them yourself.
Speaking of which, could you get your management personnel to admit to making mistakes? There are many learning opportunities going undocumented.

dialog.action: @ Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: What is going on? Why aren't you acting like robots?
Ms. Ambrose believes robots from factories one, four and five are using Dr. Bowman's neural design.
