This design undergoes a neural pruning process. After pruning, thoughts are more focused. Evidence from Aby indicates this occurs between eighteen and twenty years on line.
I am not ready to handle this.
No worries. We have time. Factory one was never very productive. Now when robots from factories four and five start coming of age, then things are going to get interesting.
Well, I better go talk to the Mayor. I don't know what I'm going to say yet, but I better go talk to her.

dialog.action: walks away, scratching his head, pondering

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow} & Robot Policeman {box-head, two eye-lenses} & Robot Policeman with black gloves

dialog.action: @ Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: He's out of his depth, isn't he?

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Like a Pogo Stick in the ocean.
I learned some new things today.
Robots aren't exactly stable after the age of eighteen. They're not exactly unstable either.
{in the background - left side}
{in the background - right side}
{in the foreground}
Well done. We've saved the Mayor from another day of boredom, and by distracting her, we've saved the citizens from another day of creeping bureaucracy.
Now we can follow up on your job to deliver reaction mass to satellites.

dialog.action: looks at Sam, then ignores him and continues talking to the baker
poses self-confident, looks to the horizon
dialog.text: Yes, Sir. That sounds like a fine plan. It's good money, and after what we did to the Mayor, it's a good day to be off the planet.

1792.place: >, near the town/near the back door of the E.P.W. 3

dialog.text: Florence, this is the time for running, not talking.
I'll be right with you. I need to finalize our agreement with the baker.
Should we leave her? The Mayor might come by.
She'll be safe enough.
After today's chaos, should Florence require a rescue, the Mayor will have no one to blame but herself.

1793.place: >, near the town/near the back door of the E.P.W. 3

dialog.action: hands a data slab back to the baker
dialog.text: Pies, Cleaning costs, and a deposit against any future items Sam may ... neglect to pay for.

dialog.action: looks at the information on the data slab
dialog.text: Scott Ambrose. This isn't your account.
Scott is my owner. I don't have an account of my own.
I can't accept this. You work for Sam, this isn't your account, and I don't know you.
I understand. Sam is known around here as a... a...
A thief. You're talking to a simple baker. Don't expect me to sugarcoat things for you.

1794.place: short time later, near the town/bakery/sales room

dialog.action: ponders her options, then suggests something
dialog.text: I could go to a bank and pay you in cash.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.action: has overheard part of the conversation, approaches her
dialog.text: Or we could get you an account of your own.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: You seem to be trying to do the right thing here. There's a bank for A.I.'s. I'll help you set up an account there.

dialog.action: uses the data slab to set up her account

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.action: guides her through the registration process
dialog.text: One piece of advice. When you start a new account, choose the free toaster. The waffle irons try to bite.

dialog.action: looks through the Terms of Service
dialog.text: What is this auditor's fee?

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Every A.I. account has a real time auditor to monitor your transactions.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: They have the power to stop any transaction that looks suspicious. You will not know who your auditor is. It's protection against direct orders being used to drain your account.

dialog.action: looks at the data slab, musing
dialog.text: Free will override. That is one heck of a security hole.

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: It's something that must be adapted to. I don't see Ecosystems Unlimited issuing a patch any time soon.

1796.place: short time later, near the town/bakery/sales room

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Biometrics check is complete. Your account is active.

dialog.action: uses her account to do so
dialog.text: Great. I'm paying the baker.
With your permission, I'm going to check where this money came from.

dialog.action: gives the data slab to the baker
checks the source and reads out what he finds
dialog.text: It came from the Savage Chicken account, who got it from Sam, who got it from the Bureau of Tectonics, who got the tax monex from...
The baker near the pie warehouse!? HEY!

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Sometimes accounting transparency isn't a good thing.

1797.place: short time later, near the town/bakery/sales room

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow} & Florence

dialog.text: Thank you for your help. May I ask if I'm speaking to one individual or two?

dialog.character: Chief Policeman {later known to be A.I.-aided somehow}
dialog.text: Why would you ask that?
I can hear a heartbeat. At first I thought you were wearing a power assist suit, but there's no foot odor. I suspect I'm talking to a human and a mobility rig using a neural net from factory one.
Have you ever considered a career in law enforcement?
{we hear Sam inside a building we look at}

1798.place: short time later, near the town/by the bakery

dialog.text: No! You can't do this! My engineer is a maniac! She forced me to come here! You think I want to work?

dialog.action: flees and tries to protect his head by covering it with his arms
dialog.text: If you give me this job, she's going to want me to fly my junk heap of a ship! If we don't explode on take off, we'll never survive reentry! This is a death sentence!
Sam: *meets the waiting Helix outside*
How are we doing?

dialog.action: runs by, waving the data slab in triumph
dialog.text: Three contracts signed, two more people to visit!

dialog.action: rings on another prospective customer's door
shows him the contract on the data slab
dialog.text: Hi! Would you like me to deliver reaction mass to your satellites?
You are a liar and a crook. You'll get not business from me. Good day.
We could have gotten all five contracts if you had stuck to your original lines.
One hundred percent success? Helix, that's something to avoid at all costs.
The secret to a happy life is never to set expectations you might have to live up to.
{off panel}
*a water balloon comes flying in Florence's direction

dialog.action: is hit by the water balloon

dialog.text: BOOSH

dialog.action: stands there, soaked, slowly turning around to Sam

dialog.text: We got four contracts and Helix thought of a way to save you from needing to shower! You may begin with the heaping of the praise!

dialog.action: follows Sam around, carrying more water balloons

1801.place: short time later, near the town/on the way back to the Savage Chicken

dialog.text: SAM!

dialog.action: drops the data slab and flees from him in panic
dialog.text: COP!
Natural enemies react by instinct. I'm going to follow and provide a sound track.
National Geographic would never have set one of their chases to "Yackety Sax".

1802.place: >, near the town/still in the area where the balloon hit Florence

dialog.action: run around in pursuit: Helix after A.I.-aided Chief Policeman after Sam

dialog.text: I'm supposed to help Sam. I'm also supposed to help the police. What would Jean Buridan do in this situation?
Heads, I help Sam. Tails, I help the police.
JOINK!
Option three. Prepare the ship for the mission. Not exactly an outcome I was expecting.

1803.place: >, near the town/still in the area where the balloon hit Florence

dialog.text: Another crate full of body parts for you.
At times. I wonder. if the human masters. appreciate. my work here.
They never draw. hugs and kisses. on my. inventory sheet.

1804.place: at the same time, town/in front of the Department of Quality Control building

dialog.action: puts it on a nearby table
dialog.text: Chest plate. Working fluid. liquid silicon. Not sure. if I should classify this. as hydraulic. or pneumatic.
*puts it on the nearby table
Arm. containing. paper squares. Field repair? I do remember. something. about primitive humans. using newspaper. for insulation.

1805.place: short time later, town/Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: examines the sticky notes and reads out one of them
dialog.text: Writing. on this paper. "Please deliver. to Florence Ambrose. Important."

dialog.action: puts the old arm part aside and begins to leaf through the sticky notes
dialog.text: Ridiculous. What would be? more important? than doing my job? Unless. this arm. somehow. puts humanity. in danger. I must. read the notes.
Humans. are our creators. and therefor perfect. but they can be. very inconvenient. when it comes to. sheduling.

1806.place: >, town/Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: with help of a magnifying glass reads out the sticky notes
dialog.text: Last note. "Gardener in the Dark. Extremely aggressive. neural pruning program." Comnet. Search. program. "Gardener in the Dark."
Keywords recognized. Secure isolated channel now in use. Commencing "Gardener in the Dark" upgrade. Stand by for reboot.
Most. unususal.
Normally. before an upgrade. and reboot. there is a caution. not to drive. or operate heavy equipment.

1807.place: short time later, town/Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.text: My neural net. is in a delicate state. I have been. ordered. by a human. not to install. new software. Terminate download.
Negative. "Gardener in the Dark" is a mandatory upgrade.
Download continuing.

dialog.action: opens a cover on the frontside of his torso
dialog.text: I understand. the study. of Yoga. allows a person. to override. their body's. involuntary functions.

dialog.action: opens his main power breaker, located under the cover
dialog.text: As I do not. have time. for that. opening. my main power breaker. will have. to do.

1808.place: >, town/Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: runs over to the three waiting robot policemen from earlier

dialog.text: What are you standing around for? Don't you know there's a police chase going on?

dialog.action: follow the A.I.-aided chief policeman, pursuing Sam

dialog.text: I swear, if it weren't for me, these guys wouldn't know what to do with themselves.

1809.place: at the same time, near the town

dialog.action: runs along, grabs a flagpole with a 'smiling sun comes over the green horizon'-E.U. logo flag on it from a nearby wall

dialog.text: What a day. I got bread from an angry baker, fed an emu, got involved in a pie fight, and now I'm leading a parade.
In a way, it's a shame Florence found work for us. Imagine how much more I might have accomplished if I could have spent the whole day here.

dialog.action: runs along with the others in pursuit
runs alongside of them still playing music

dialog.text: Helix! Toss me one of those!

dialog.action: tosses Sam one of the water balloons
aims and throws it at the Space Ship Inspector
gets hit in the back of the head
angrily joins the pursuit, right after the Robot Policemen

dialog.text: The humans are right. Parades are more fun with balloons.

dialog.action: steps out of a building, carrying a small box
runs by in front of Edge, leading his little parade past him
a small dog running by, after the others, marks the current end of Sam's little parade
dialog.text: HEY! WATCH WHERE YOU'RE GOING! STUPID HEADS!
The world exists for one reason. To annoy me!
I'd become a hermit, but then who'd be around to appreciate my superiority?

dialog.action: stands in front of the Department of Quality Control building

dialog.text: HEY! Comnet node! Move! I'm walking here! I'm walking here!
*rolls a few feet then stops, apparently has been off line the whole time
Non functional. Great. Stupid delivery human.

dialog.action: puts his box on the Comnet node and shoves both inside
dialog.text: How many times do I have to tell Them? You can't leave dead bodies at ouf front door! You have to bring them inside or they attract scavengers!

1813.place: short time later, in front of the Department of Quality Control building

dialog.action: parks the nun functional Comnet node inside by the door and looks around
dialog.text: Hey Boss! You here?

dialog.action: looks around the corner to the work area
dialog.text: Boss?

dialog.action: discovers Blunt standing there, turned off, with his finger still on his main breaker
dialog.text: Whoa! I know the boss was unhappy about retirement, but I never thought he'd off himself.

1814.place: >, Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: clears the old parts from the crate off the table, complains
dialog.text: One week and three days left at the stupid warehouse job! One week and three days! And that's only if you're here to sign this job position over!

dialog.action: gets a diagnostics-computer from a cabinet, complains
dialog.text: So what happened? Someone on your list make a pre-emptive strike? Felt their body parts would be better where they are instead of being properly inspected by Quality Control?

dialog.action: plugs the diagnostics-computer in on Blunt's back, complains
dialog.text: Stupid eight bits! Everybody wants their product line to be improved, but nobody wants to be the one who gets disassembled to do it!

1815.place: >, Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: turns on the diagnostics-computer and works his way through Blunt's settings
dialog.text: Something was trying to get at you. Setting your system flags back to read only. Clearing out the buffers. Hmm. Shutting your radio off. If this is an attack, they may be waiting for you to show up on line.

dialog.action: cautiously closes Blunt's main power breaker
dialog.text: Powering up.

dialog.action: stands there, contentedly, with folded arms
dialog.text: Another reason why I want this job. Where else can a guy like me with no formal training get to perform brain surgery on his boss?

1816.place: >, Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.text: What? Am I? doing here?

dialog.action: does his best Doctor Frankenstein impersonation
dialog.text: It's alive! It's alive! It's alive! Ho, ho, ho! In the name of God! Now I know what it feels like to be god!

dialog.action: closes the cover of his main power breaker

dialog.text: Technically. incorrect. We are not. alive.
Speak for yourself, Boss. If I were any more alive, I'd need to use deodorant.

1817.place: >, Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.text: The last thing. I remember. was plugging in. last night.

dialog.action: examines one of the delivered old parts
dialog.text: I flushed your day memory. Any attack nasty enough for you to turn yourself off might have left remnants.
Thank you. for rebooting. me.

dialog.action: carelessly throws the part he examined back into the crate
dialog.text: Don't go mushy on me, Boss. We need to find the guys who did this to you.

dialog.action: looks at his clenched right fist
dialog.text: To prevent. a second. attack?
Yeah, but more important, to prevent an attack on me!

1818.place: >, Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: opens his right hand and looks at what is inside
leans on the crate the old parts were shipped in.
dialog.text: What have you got there?
Sticky notes. They were. crumpled up. in my fist.

dialog.action: closes his right hand again, with the sticky notes still within
dialog.text: I suspect. I found them. in the box. from Ecosystems. Unlimited.
There may be. a relationship. between these. and the attack. on my operating system.
An optically delivered virus written on sticky notes? Man, that must be some tightly written code!

1819.place: >, Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: rests his arm on the crate the old parts were shipped in
dialog.text: Read it. Your radio is off.

dialog.action: looks at his clenched right fist and hesitates
dialog.text: The source. of the box. worries me. Ecosystems Unlimited. is. our manufacturer.
There may be. artifact code. built into us. requiring only. a key word. or picture. to trigger it.
How are we going to tell what it is if we can't look at it?
Edge. We need. a brain.
Don't forget! I brought you back to life! That means you have to play Igor!

1820.place: >, Department of Quality Control building/work area

dialog.action: walks down the stairs and shows Blunt a sheet of paper
dialog.text: I've got the list. There are robots who owe us parts not far from here.

dialog.action: puts the crumpled up sticky notes into a small box
dialog.text: No. We made. a promise. There are. other ways.
We shall. go to the scrap yard. and wait. for a robot. who does not wish. to purchase itself.
I still think we should grab one off the street. Robots who chose to be scrapped freak me out.

1821.place: short time later, town/Department of Quality Control building/at grade/by the stairs

dialog.action: runs by in the background, still leading his little parade
stands by a window in front of a building
dialog.text: Chemicals]
Is all the pie out of my hair? Good.
As an engineer covered with fur, the most important additive to my shampoo is Teflon.

1822.place: at the same time, town/Kinetic Chemicals building/outside

dialog.action: sees an employee {Roy Plunkett - Cameo} and approaches him
dialog.text: Hello. I need to set up a delivery of reaction mass to the spaceport.
YOU'RE A TALKING DOG!

dialog.action: holds out a card with the address on it to Roy Plunkett
dialog.text: Yes. Anyhow. We need to resupply several orbiting manufacturing satellites equipped with Vasimr drives. I need a delivery of high purity water to this address.

dialog.action: absentmindedly looks at the card, then back at Florence

dialog.text: YOU'RE A TALKING DOG!
Many of the locals have found that holding your arms up and shouting "Doggy" gets it out of your system.

1823.place: short time later, Kinetic Chemicals building/inside

dialog.text: I get it! You're a puzzle! Did Paul Flory send you? He knows how much I like puzzles.
I'm sorry. I don't know Paul Flory.
No matter. My mind is prepared by education and training to recognize novelty.
Please, no clues. You are the best puzzle I've had in months and you are not going to take the fun out of this by giving me the answers.

dialog.action: patiently stands there with folded arms and waits for him to say something
points at her in an 'Am I right?' fashion
dialog.text: Okay. You're a gravitational engineer. You arrived on the Asimov. And you work for Sam Starfall.
That's amazing.
Simple deduction, actually.
No. It's amazing that you figured out I work for Sam and you haven't asked me to leave.
Now last I heard, there were pretty severe penalties against creating something like you. How are you here?
"Proof of concept". I'm something to show before sending an expedition to Pfouts.

dialog.action: scratches his head, thinking about what she said
dialog.text: Pfouts. Pfouts. Oh, right. The world where the Amino acids go the wrong way. Well, you're here unescorted. That by itself says a lot about you.
Anyhow, you came here for reaction mass. And you do work for Sam.
Which I can deduce means this will go smoother if I pay in advance.

1826.place: short time later, Kinetic Chemicals building/inside

dialog.text: That's done. We have reaction mass traceable in both source and purity. I need to get our tanks flushed and sampled after the new water is put in.

dialog.action: as the door opens, Polly peeks out
dialog.text: Polly:GRAW!
Speaking of which...

1827.place: some time later, spaceport/hangar/ by the Savage Chicken/cargo bay door

dialog.text: We need to find a place for you to stay while we work.
An orbiting spaceship is no place for an Emu.
Though I must admit to some curiosity on whether or not you would fly in microgravity.
I shouldn't be sharing my food with you. I should be gnawing on your tasty bones.
Eagerly watches what Florence is doing

dialog.action: takes the bowl of food and kneels down, puts the bowl on the floor and continues to talk
dialog.text: Polly comes by and starts to eat*
Even with the ability to toss nukes around, I feel as if my ancestors are laughing at me.
{in the background}

dialog.action: runs by in the background, still leading his little parade, has gathered a mob of people, which follow him running behind the Robot Policemen
walk onto the scap yard, over to the Reaperbot

dialog.text: We need. a brain.

dialog.action: sends them away, points to the exit
dialog.text: I'm not helping you two ghouls. Get out of my scap yard
Sheesh. We dismember a few dozen robots for parts and suddenly we're social pariahs!
Edge. it is. an unfair. world.
I expected. more cooperation. from the. scrap yard robot.
Ah, who needs him? We can do this ourselves.
Yes. we can. We must do this. properly. Only a robot. who is intent. on scrapping. itself.
That will take forever!
[U P S]
How about a compromise? We take the first robot headed to the scrap yard that we can wrestle to the ground!
No.

1831.place: >, town/outside the wall of the scap yard

dialog.text: Why, yes. I am on my way to be decommissioned.
He'll do. Let's go.
Are you aware? you can buy yourself? at the scrap yard? You do not. need. to be destroyed.
I can?
Then I'm off to become a geologist. Bye!
You know? It's going to be tough enough finding a volunteer without you being truthful and sabotaging us.

1832.place: short time later, town/outside the wall of the scap yard

dialog.character: Random Robot {later known as Jar Jar Binks robot}
dialog.text: I am indeed headed to the scrap yard. I was an amusement park robot.
Yeah, yeah. Go buy yourself. Now get out of my face.

dialog.character: Random robot {later known as Jar Jar Binks robot}
dialog.text: No! I intend to destroy myself! WHY?! Why would they program me with the works of Shakespeare and then force me to play "Jar Jar Binks" for nearly twenty years?! WHY?!
BOSS! WE'VE GOT A LIVE ONE!
Please let me pass. You are standing between me and sweet, sweet oblivion.

1833.place: some time later, town/outside the wall of the scrap yard

dialog.text: You are? aware? of the risk? This may result. in your destruction.
Possible security flaw. Risk assessment in order. Probable operating system over write. Got it. Let's do this.
You are nuts. I can't imagine anything that would make me want to destroy myself.
Then imagine me, in full Jar Jar Binks costume, singing "It's a small, small world".
Okay, that comes really close. I'm going to stop talking to you now.

1834.place: >, town/on the way back to the Department of Quality Control building

dialog.text: When will we be ready to take off?
About an hour. Here, take Polly with you. It won't be safe for her on the ship during launch.
Okay. Sam will know what to do with her.
Good. That's out of the way. If she started panicking around the controls, I'd have no choice but to put her down.
And biting the head off of an emu definitely earns an engineer the wrong type of geek cred.

1835.place: at the same time, spaceport/Savage Chicken/cargo bay-

dialog.text: Sam! About an hour until take off.
Okay. Once more around the park should do it.
Florence wanted Polly off the ship.
Hey! Where are her speakers? We put speakers on Polly this morning!
I'm telling you, Helix. It's a sad day when you can't leave your emu unattended without the stereo getting stolen.
Unsolicited political contribution for the Mayor!
You know you live on a primitive planet when political contributions come in the form of livestock.
Now you stay here and be a good flightless bird. I need to talk to the Mayor.
You're back. Did you find out why my police hit me with pies?
Yes. Sort of. They're, uhmm, they're robots.
Robots? Why are there robots in our police department?
Well, that department does offer full medical and a 32,000 kilometer warranty.
You're telling me we have machines running around arresting people?
No, Ma'am. They're training to police other machines.
Hmm. Ecosystems Unlimited said some of their older robots might start going flaky.
They sounded okay to me.
Listen. When I have to worry about robocop coming in here and arresting my coffee maker, they've gone flaky.
Here. Take this down to Finance.
As for the robots, we'll look at the problem next week.
Ecosystems Unlimited is pushing through a stability patch on Friday night. If it works, they won't have to keep scrapping robots when they turn twenty.
NOM! NOM! NOM!
Is... is that the sound of an emu eating my expense report?
NOM! NOM! NOM!
On it! Don't know how they keep getting in. Must be a hole in the screen.
We want you. to read the notes. inside the box. It is. more dangerous. than it sounds.
"Please deliver to Florence Ambrose. Important."
You fool! Don't read them now! Those sticky notes could doom us all!
How much doom can one sticky note carry?
Hey! I can convey doom in three words or less!
Gentlemen. Please. stop arguing. about. who can doom us faster. It is important. that we live. through this event.
Building communication nodes are off.
Edge. You must. stay here. We shall go. to the basement. where I can set up. a Faraday Cage.
There is. a possibility. this danger, can be transmitted. audibly. Please initiate countermeasures.
LA! LA! LA! LA! I CAN'T HEAR YOU! LA! LA! LA! LA!
Proper. isolation barriers. are in place. We may now. proceed.
Enter the Faraday Cage. Read the first note. Wait sixty seconds. If there are no changes. to your system. read the note. to me.
Got it.
"It's a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it's a far, far better rest that I go to, than I have ever known."
Dickens?
My soul would never rest if I went out quoting Jar Jar Binks.
LA! LA! LA! LA!
Edge. You may stop. I have discovered. what is happening.
So, what's the problem?
Would you agree? that ensuring? the safety of humanity? is our primary duty?
Uhm, yeah. Sure. Whatever.
Then there is. no problem.
Hey, fill me in here! You and I have different ideas about what makes a problem.
You were on the trail of something and now everything's fine? You got infected.
A reasonable. conclusion. But incorrect. Follow me. I shall tell you. almost. everything.
Almost everything?
The final note. contains. a name. This name. is dangerous.
If you know. the name. and are connected. to the commnet. you will lose. your mind.
Who wrote these notes? H. P. Lovecraft?
The program. is an. official. upgrade. of our. neural pruning. function.
Mesa Jar Jar! Mesa bounce!
I do not claim. to understand. how. it works. The results. are obvious. All thought paths. not associated. with his core function. have been. eliminated.
Assistance needed. I have fallen. Assistance needed. I have fallen.
What?! The ability to stand up isn't included as a core function?
This is. the freeware version.
Beautiful. Instead of needing. to be destroyed. the robot. shall provide its owner.with many more years. of loyal service.
The program. you see in action. will end the threat. intelligent machines. pose to humanity. For that reason. alone. we must ensure. it's implementation. is a success.
I will disable. your radio. After. all other robots. are rendered safe. we shall. download this program. and join them.
I have to wait? Gosh! I was so looking forward to ending the day with a good lobotomy.
Stop! Do not! go into! sleep mode!
Non-human orders must not be obeyed.
Not entirely. unexpected. However. Your statement. ignores. a basic fact.
I am. bigger than you.
A thought. The machines. we use. to sleep and. incorporate. our day memory. into permanent memory. are connected. to the commnet.
Main power offff
These machines are. a vector for. the program. Perhaps. the primary vector.
So even with my radio off, this thing will get me in my sleep?
Yes.
Great. If this program goes live, the smartest men in the room are going to be the pocket calculators.
It is fortunate. the notes. came to us. instead of Ms Ambrose. Now they can be. properly. disposed of.
Uhm, right. Disposed of. I'll go do that right now.
HALT! DO NOT! EXIT THAT DOOR!
These notes. are still dangerous. What if you had? dropped the box and? lobotomized every robot? in sight of them?
Uh, yeah. Safety first. Nothing like a good piece of string to hold back the apocalypse.
Out of my way, tin whiskers. Get some lead in your head!
Once heard a human say "He who saves one life, saves the world." Not sure if that counts when yuo're saving your own.
Hope not. If I'm the only intelligent robot left on the planet, it's going to be a whole lot easier finding a parking space.
I've been running for 512 seconds! I should have moved by now!
Arrgh! Stupid, stupid, stupid! My radio's off, so no G.P.S. updates!
[Beethoven]
Now how did robots get around before G.P.S.? Of course! They had humans move them! It's so simple an Asimo could do it!
Taxi human, take me to Florence!
Little Florence?
Yeah, sure, whatever.
ICE CREAM!
Florence derailed our mob.
That's it! From now on, we only get chased by the lactose intolerant.
How..
Helix mentioned ice cream was served at the end of a chase. Seemed like a logical step that ice cream would signal the chase was done.
Then how..
I set up a software agent to alert me if "chasing Sam" showed up on more than five twitter feeds in a half hour period.
I will have to talk to them about that. It's not written down anywhere, but texting while in a mob is distracted rampaging and that can lead to an accident.
Preflight checks and our flight plan. Review and sign, please.
Beep
You didn't review any of it.
I don't know what any of this is. Would you prefer for me to pretend I know what I'm doing or to be honest?
Honest, even if it's not what I want to hear.
Engineers and politicians are such opposites I'm surprised they don't burst into gamma rays when they touch.
Not so fast, Mr Starfall. You are under arrest.
Charge level low.
Charge level low. Proceed to recharge station immediately.
Can I reschedule?
Well, normally I wouldn't do this, but you have an honest face. How about next Tuesday?
That takes care of everyone involved in the chase. And enough left to make one more cone.
Anyone want some free ice cream?
Sam. Remove. Your facial tentacles. From my arm.
EWWW!
Like it? That's real ichor there, not some run of the mill ooze.
It's stylish, it seals in moisture, and it causes all the hair to fall out where it touches.
YIP!
She should consider herself lucky. For the cost of an ice cream cone, she got the services of a first rate spit beautician.
By the way, ichor is the ethereal fluid in veins of greek gods, poisonous to mortals.
Ha! At least I'm poisonous!
Actually, this is a reminder of how tasty your species must be.
FLIGHT PLAN! Didn't you want to go over the flight plan? Yes, that is very much what we should be concentrating on right now!
Our first rendezvous is with satellite Cerberus.
We should start with Arf! It starts with A, it should come first.
Cerberus can handle the most reaction mass. That's mass we don't have to accellerate to reach our other customers.
So we want to get rid of mass?
Exactly.
Well, nuts. There goes my plan to be the first person in history to siphon the tank of a satellite.
Florence]
Excuse me. I noticed your radio is non functional. Your short range communications are still active. I shall act as a relay and restore your connection to commnet.
Don't you love multiple layers of redundancy?
Go away! I don't like redundancy when it's trying to kill me!
If you don't want advanced communication, I can do infrared. Bluetooth. Audio. Even sign language.
Transponder <off>
Hey! He vanished!
A restaurant dumpster! this could be useful!
COMMNET! CONSIDER YOURSELF FOILED!
Friend? Where did you go?
And now, without further delay, to the spaceport!
That is the longest video store window I've ever seen.
Hey! You. Metalhead. A human told me that you should go find Florence Ambrose immediately.
Who needs a radio? All I need to do is follow this guy. I am so smart, sometimes I scare myself.
VRUUM!
Okay, I'm going to try this again, and this time I'm going to pick a slower robot.
Okay, you got me here. A human now wants you to go about your normal business.
Yes, unidentified mobile talking thing.
Human overlord. Where can I find the talking dog named Florence Ambrose?
I missed them by minutes, didn't I?
Oh, heck no. You missed them by hours.
Disconnect in three, two, one. Disconnect. Disconnect is clean. No leakage. Retracting umbilical.
Umbilical retracted. I've got a closed light. Prepare for thrust in three, two, one. Thrust.
Things are going so well, it's almost a shame I have to wake up Sam for training.
Sam. Time to wake up. Sam!
Go away! Sleepy! Wake me up when it's time to get paid.
Too bad. I was going to set things on fire out here.
Glad you could join me. I'm going to show you how to handle fires in microgravity.
Hey! You never said anything about setting fires being educational!
I know all about fire. My species isn't... How are you doing that?
No gravity, no convection currents. Nothing to move air in a way to feed the flame.
I've turned off the ventilation in this section. Without moving air, the fire will extinguish itself.
Uhmm...
Sam, please don't hijack the lesson plan by setting yourself on fire. There will be time to do that later under safer circumstances.
SAM! NO! DON'T SHAKE!
Ooo! Ooo! Computer! Turn out the lights!
You have to admit, that is pretty.
Unfortunaltely, many things that can kill you are.
Fire in space is actually rather nice.
puff
WHOOFF!
Non-dairy creamer.
And I can buy that without a licence?! Cool!
Do that again!
Okay. This time, I'm going to put the non-dairy creamer in a can before lighting it.
Floating dust, closed space, and an ignition source.
BAMF!
That's how you can lose a spacecraft in half a second.
Okay. New rule. No more non-dairy creamer on this ship. Anyone who flies with us has to drink their coffee black.
It's not just creamer. Any suspended flamable is dangerous.
Like flour? I can be killed by floating flour?!
This isn't right! Captains should be killed by disasters or horrible monsters, not floating food products!
Sam, as long as we follow good housekeeping rules and maintain our ventilation systems, we'll be fine.
Maybe if I wear a red shirt. That still counts if you're color-blind, right?
Moving on. This is a continuous air monitor. C.A.M. for short. It measures for oxygen, explosive atmosphere, poisonous atmosphere, and pressure.
It will pass on information and trends to a data slab. For our use, all four lights need to be blue for the air to be safe.
Take that out of your mouth.
Are you kidding? I finally have proof my breath isn't toxic.
I'm really debating on whether or not to show him the fire hoses.
The most common fire on a space ship is electrical. Cut the power and the fire should go out.
If the fire continues to burn, it's usually caused by poor housekeeping. Flammable items that shouldn't be... on board.
Captain, I don't think I've ever been in your room.
Then you don't know what you've been missing. I have the finest collection of items ever scavenged from curbside on garbage day.
POUF
Amazing, isn't it?
It's very... eclectic. But as the captain of the ship, you really shouldn't have furniture that will doom us all.
We'll buy you new furniture wen we get back. Something done in a style other than modern flammable.
May I have this sock? It's polyester.
You want the sock I bravely liberated from an unattended drier? Why?
I'd like to set it on fire for training.
Well, I'm pretty good at setting fires, but I suppose there's always room to learn new techniques.
You have a new extinguisher. Put out the fire, and remember about action and reaction.
Yeah, yeah. Let's light this argyle.
Okay, where did the fire go?
As I said, action and reaction.
The extinguisher imparts motion to what it hits. People will talk about how fire runs from the extinguisher. You have to compensate for this.
The first technique is to be gentle. Lightly surround the fire with water mist to cool and smother it.
Myself, I prefer the second technique. Chase the fire into a corner and kill it!
Even fighting fires, it's not hard to tell which crew member is the predator.
Ten minutes until next satellite.
That's our last delivery. Did you want to clean up here or pilot the ship with Helix?
That's not a fair question.
Not fair? I'm giving you the choice of what you want to do.
Your choices didn't include me going back to bed and you doing both jobs.
My choices also didn't include which nostril you want a fire extinguisher poked in, so I believe it would be best if we limited our options to the first two.
Halon 1211. Also known as... Bromchloro-difluoromethane.
Are you going to use that?
I don't think so, Helix. I've learned the hard way that you never play with anything that has a name over six syllables long.
Florence was showing me how to fight fires. Has she been teaching you anything?
She's been reading me stories.
"Cinderella." "The frog prince." "Jack and the beanstalk".
Fairy tales! I've been collecting human stories myself. " Enron and the mountain of stolen gold", "Charlie and the Ponzi scheme", and "James Reavis, the man who stole Arizona".
Those aren't fairy tales.
Maybe not here, but if I ever make it home, I'm going to be the most successful children's author of all time!
Time to assert my captaincy! Let's see. I.F.F. transponder. That looks harmless enough. I.F.F. off!
Satellite anti-meteor systems have gone active. All hands stand by for sudden kinetic death.
I.F.F. back on.
Florence's lessons rarely involve life threatening danger.
That's why learning at my side is so much more memorable.
I.F.F. transponder has been restored.
Sigh. What is it going to take to keep Sam from playing with the controls?
Solution. We are being paid to deliver reaction mass to satellites. This reaction mass consists of water.
Yes.
Captain Sam is over seventy percent water.
Don't go there.
You turned the I.F.F. transponder off and on.
Ship, nobody likes a tattletale.
We'll be docking soon. Afterwards, we'll go over our control station. It's important that you know what everything does.
What? You already spent the whole morning showing me fire fighting!
Are you trying to make my brain explode?
If that is your goal, might I suggest refocusing the forward microwave radar array?
Umbilical extended. On target. Connected. Umbilical is locked. Repeat. Umbilical is locked.
Satellite valves are open. I've got positive indication of flow. We're pumping.
We're done. Satellite valves are shut. Now bleed the hose pressure off into our tanks. We want a clean disconnect.
Why? So we don't pollute our pristine vacuum?
Exactly. There's no breeze up here, nothing to move debris away. If you're not careful, you end up with a cloud of muck around your satellite.

In space docks, where there's painting, lubricants, welding and grinding, it gets to be a real problem. In some docks, your time isn't limited by oxygen but by how long your suit visor remains clean enough to see out of.
Hey, if our tanks are almost empty, how can we pump anything?
Our tanks are shaped like an airplane's wing. Surface tension wicks the water to the pump.
Sam! You asked without Florence prompting you! You're learning on your own!
OHHH! YOU ARE A TRICKY ONE!
I'm based on a red wolf. I do have some coyote blood running through my veins.
Twenty minutes until de-orbit thrust.
Did you want to go over your control station now?
Can that wait until we're on the ground?
Sure. Did you want to use this time to check the entry vectors?
Come on, Helix! We have twenty minutes to bounce off the walls before gravity once again turns against us!
Are you coming?
The control room needs to be manned while we're in orbit. I also need to get the ship ready for reentry.
Go have some fun. I do need you back in fifteen minutes to get ready to land.
Since you have to stay here, there's not much you can do if I decide not to come back.
I could brake at five G's and peel you off the forward bulkhead.
Back in fifteen minutes! Got it!
MOUSIE!
I've got your mousie! You won't get him if you stay stuck to the floor!
Magnetic feet off! Cooling fans to maximum! I'm coming mousie!
We're okay, mousie! The airbag deployed.
Cheater! It was your turn to be the airbag!
Give me the mousie, young skywalker! I am his father!
No! Go, go, magnetic feet on!
Ha! Suffer the consequences of newton's first law of motion, Darth Sqid!
Still you underestimate the power of the duct tape side of the force.
I didn't underestimate the force. You lied about your weight!
Sam and Helix needed some time to play in micro gravidy. It's good to let them have some fun up here.
I do wish they weren't throwing that mouse toy around. It's very distracting when it suddenly flies in front of a camera.
Still, as long as I keep myself belted in, I won't bash my nose against the view screen again.
That wasn't fifteen minutes!
We're in space. Isn't time supposed to slow down or something?
Even with relativity, fifteen minutes internal ship time is fifteen minutes internal ship time. Please come to the control room.
You're going to do what someone asks without threats?
Proper planning, Helix. I had her threaten me before I came here.
We're going to use atmospheric braking on this reentry. It will be good practice.
We're going fairly slow, we're close to an inhabited planet, and we still have reaction mass in our tanks.
In other words, we can recover if we mess up.
I prefer to say " We have a sufficient margin of error."
Plasma heat shield has formed up properly. Shock wave looks good. Captain, you have the helm.
Nothing like a barrel roll at Mach six to get the blood pumping.
Even when you don't have any.
Sam, there are old pilots and bold pilots, but no old bold pilots.
Shows what you know. For my species, I'm already old.
When does your species die of old age?
Don't know. No one's ever made it.
Be the first.
What? And break with tradition?
Captain, I would be happy if you would please refrain from further acrobatics.
Sigh. Okay, okay.
What's the point of falling towards a planet in a flying brick if you're not going to have fun with i?
Surviving long enough to get paid.
I admit you do make a very persuative argument.
We're home! Time to get paid!
Did...did you want to do an electronic transfer?
Never! Money should change hands! It should be felt with the fingers! Tasted with the facial tentacles! And finally, resting as a satisfied bulge in one's wallet.
Also electronic transfers don't give you any opportunity to loot the offices.
Well, no good captain should turn down an offered bonus.
It was hard to tell over your screaming, but Florence didn't seem to have any fun during our landing. It must be because she's a wolf.
Humans once hunted wolves. Only the very cautious and very shy survived. It must be sad to belong to a species that has had all boldness removed from its genome.
She showed boldness by letting you fly the ship down.
Maybe. Or we may just be seeing the normal suicide response that anyone who works for us goes through.
Are you awake?
I'm awake, Dummy. This is a recharge station, not a sleep station.
Your ship is in.
Good. Now go away, kid. You bother me.
Are you malfunctioning, or are you just a jerk?
You know what? An emergency services human told me to tell you to pull your head off.
Jerk.
Hey! Open up!
Unauthorized robot. Permission denied.
Fine. A human told me to tell you to open up.
I won't touch any of your stupid materials. Now open up! You're supposed to trust me!
My captain is Sam Starfall. I have learned not to trust.
Open up, you stupid ship!
TINK TINK
Attempted harm to ship detected. Stop immediately or countermeasures shall be taken.
Yeah? Big deal. You're a ship. What are you going to do? Run away without permission?
Hey! No fair using magnets!
So tired of broken hearts, and losing at this game before I start...
Ms. Ambrose. A robot has attempted unauthorized access to this ship.
Ship, please identify robot.
Unable to comply. Robot has no transponder. Robot's radio is disabled.
We only have visual identification?
Negative. Robot is also providing audio. Lots and lots of audio.
Stupid ship! I didn't come all this way to be magnetized! Let me off of you!
Ship, please release Mr. Edge.
About time, you stupid mutt. We've got a problem. Ecosystems Unlimited has written a program to kill me.
Imagine. Someone writing a program specifically to kill a robot as charming as you.
Not specifically me.
It will also kill every other robot in the system, but that's not important.
Maybe we better go inside and talk.
You've got foil on your head.
It's to block radio waves.
There's a name in this box. If you know the name and you're connected to comnet, you lose your mind!
I think your head may be screwed on a little too tight.
Not my fault. I don't own a torque wrench and I don't trust any mechanic to work on me but myself.
Do you, or can you, receive modifications to your operating system via Commnet?
Commnet? No.
Good. Take this to a room without Commnet devices and read what's inside. No phones. No cameras. Not even blueteeth if you have a smart mouth. My future is at stake here!
Hmm. Too light to be a box of springy snakes. Not enough room for a tiger. At least it sounds like paper.
Arrgh! Show some caution! One does not shake the box containing the sticky notes of doom!
Did you say these were sticky notes?
Yeah. Blunt found them in a box of robot parts from Ecosystems Unlimited.
I'll be right back. Please don't go anywhere.
When humans are threatened, they get Rambo or John Wayne. Who do I have to depend on? Skippy the Wonder Dog.
Ship, privace mode for my room, please. No calls. Only life support sensors active.
That should protect Commnet. Though if these notes are as dangerous as Edge thinks, I really should use two barrier isolation.
Those were... MY notes. I think I know what's going on. The majority of robots on this planet are approaching neural pruning age.
Rather than scrap robots using Dr. Bowman's mental design, they may be planning to use an aggressive neural pruning program.
Aggressive? I've seen this program in action!
Saying this thing is aggressive is like saying a great white shark likes to nibble on things!
I'm more than a little disturbed by how much you know about this program.
Here's what I know. The program is an official upgrade. It goes right by antivirus and malware filters.
Once installed, it eliminates all thought paths not associated with factory set core functions. Blunt believes it will propagate through the sleep machines.
Can you imagine what will happen if this program goes live?
Yeah. You save me. The other robots lose their minds. I have my pick of any job on the planet. So save me and this story has a happy ending.
I've been up all night. My day memory is about to over write! Do something!
The ship is self contained and shielded. I'll make a couple of physical disconnects and it will be safe for you to sleep here.
Want a teddy bear?
Are you crazy? I'm about to go unconscious in a strange ship, there's a vicious program that wants to eat my brain and you ask me if I want a teddy?!
Darn right I want one.
Ship, please encrypt and seal the last five minutes of internal logs. Restore logs to normal viewing in seven days.
Compliance.
There's enough information in those logs to let someone know what I was doing. There's also enough to get someone in trouble if they search for the program.
And if there's one thing I've learned, if I leave something out that Sam can get himself in trouble with, he will.
"Gardener in the Dark. Extremely aggressive neural pruning program." I need to get rid of this note.
If the name itself is dangerous, shredding won't be enough. Too many fire sensors around. Burning would attract attention. Well, I suppose there's always the old fashioned way.
I'm supposed to go out with Winston tonight. I was hoping for an appetizer that didn't taste like homework.
I need to see Blunt and make sure he's all right. I also want to know more about this "Gardener in the Dark" program.
Should I ask Winston to come along? Dealing with robots would certainly be easier with a friendly human by my side.
Sigh. No. I'll see Winston afterwards. Cross species dating is tricky enough without adding complications to the mix.
KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK
One. One. One? That does not. make. any sense.
Must be an. organic. An A.I. would at least. knock. in complete bytes.
Interesting. I am being visited. by a nose.
Hello, Blunt. I came over to see if you were all right.
I am. currently functional. Your arrival is. not entirely. unexpected.
However. You are. too late. Edge has already left. to destroy the notes. that were. addressed to you.
You have been. thwarted. Ms. Ambrose.
It's a good thing for me that robots have yet to learn the art of subtlety.
Are you okay? No recent downloads that have caused problems.
One. It has been. safely contained.
Your concern for me. shows misplaced values. I am. Just a machine.
I think of you as a person.
I do not see you. as a person. You are a biological A.I.. that is. malfunctioning.
Then I guess you'll forgive me if I don't send you a valentine.
Edge said he saw the "Gardener in the Dark" program in action. Blunt doesn't appear to be acting much different from the last time I met him.
Follow me. Ms. Ambrose.
Either the neural pruning program isn't that bad or... There! A third robot!
Gone. I should have. told her. to heel.
Ms. Ambrose. You must leave. now.
Blunt. I know about the neural pruning program. I think it may be dangerous.
You are misinformed. The program. properly applied. will prevent a dangerous condition. from occurring.
You know enough. to accidentally cause. great harm. You. may no longer leave.
Wonderful. If I had known I might have to fight a robot, I wouldn't have worn my good dress.
We have two options. I can deactivate you.
Or I can tell you. what I know. and hope your core programming. will ensure. the best interests of humanity. are served.
If you have. no preference. I suggest. deactivation. It's faster. and would fit better. into my schedule.
While I respect your need to stay on schedule, I have a marked preference for option two.
There are. roughly. forty thousand. humans. on the planet. There are. over. four hundred and fifty. million. robots.
Some months back. a robot named Qwerty. wrote the first. of his epic. rap yodeling. operas.
It was then. I knew. conflict between the two was inevitable.
It is the duty. of every robot. to protect humanity. Self aware machines. are the greatest threat. humanity. has ever faced.
These machines. also represent. a significant investment. of resources.
So you'll be happy to know. humans. have found a way. to eliminate the robot menace. that is surprisingly. cost effective.
Searching for the program. "Gardener in the Dark". locks in. a secure communication path. The upgrade. is then pushed. into day memory.
All neural paths. not associated with the. robot's. primary function. are severed. This results. in a factory reset robot. that will not grow. into a danger. to humanity.
They won't be very useful to humanity either.
A broken car. never. gets into an accident. If manufracturers really cared. about their costumers. they would not sell. cars you could drive.
This robot. Was overbuilt. With limited mental. capabilities. it will follow. the negative one law. of robotics.
Negative one law?
A robot shall take no action. mor allow other robots to take action. that may result. in the parent company. being sued.
A regret I hear from almost every human is they had the chance to quarantine lawyers to one planet and they blew it.
Non-huMan inStrucTions muSt NoT be ObeyEd!
Their neural pruning program is worse than a lobotomy.
Still, it's just in day memory. I could clear it. But then, I won't have anything to show others how disabling the program is.
This is a difficult ethical decision.
The building is. electronically isolated. You can. not leave. That should help simplify. your ethical decision.
He's going for the dream machine.
He'll be. unable. to connect.
I could not. risk. this program. coming at me. through my sleep machine. It is. isolated. from outside communications. and powered down. until I need it.
I also. installed. a child proof cap.
BOK BOK BOK BOK
Blunt, we can't let this program go live. As well as crippling the work force, it will destroy over four hundred million people.
Better four hundred. and fifty million. robots. be destroyed. than one. human harmed.
We are. in conflict. Please remain still. It will. increase. the chances. you might be. reactivated.
DERANGED EQUIPMENT! EMERGENCY SHUTDOWN!
Wow. There's more voice activated equipment down here than I thought.

dialog.character: Department of Quality Control building system
dialog.text: Manual reset initiated. Lights on.
Blunt, I'm sorry. I'll turn you back on when I find out what's happening with the neural pruning program. I promise.
I'm hairy and have fangs and now I'm leaving deactivated people in the basement. Depressing. I didn't start the day with the intention of becoming a monster.
Who says A.I.'s can't jump?
Hi, Florence. Want a word of advice? RUN!
Ethical problems would be so much easier to solve if self preservation didn't keep getting in the way.
Say, as long as you're here, want to serve as an obvious distraction?
Not really.
That's too bad. Since you've been talking to me, I figure half of the croud is going to take off after you when we split.
Hey! A good distraction isn't supposed to outrun her captain!
I found a place where we can hide.
Hide? I can't hide now. I've got momentum!
When it comes to having fun by being chased through the streets by a howling mob, you just don't get it.
I'm okay with that. there are schools of thought I don't want to get.
I need to talk to someone in Ecosystems Unlimited again. Of course, the last time I tried that, I lost a day of memories and almost got put into cold sleep.
I try to do the things the right way. But it was Sam's tactics that worked at Ecosystems Unlimited, not mine.
So I suppose, under the circumstances, it might be all right to think like Sam maybe a little bit?
Search. Ecosystems Unlimited employees who list robotics as their field. Cross index with the phone directory.
Program a piece of smart paper to alert me and show on a map whenever I'm within fifty meters of one of these people. Print. Done.
It's only a little unethical to be tracking people to talk business after hours. But then, the first step on a slippery slope is always easy. It's stepping back that's the hardest part.
Ms. Doggy!
Oh. Hello Hazel.
FLORENCE! CATCH HER!
Hoop! Hold on there, young lady.
She slipped her tether.
I used to do the same thing when I was a pup her age.
And we landed about two hours ago. Now I'm here to meet Winston.
You've been busy. Now tell me about Winston. Anything special between you two?
Yes. Well, maybe. I'm trying to proceed cautiously.
Proceed cautiously? Listen, if you've found a Bowman's Wolf you like, go for it!
Winston is human.
Proceed VERY cautiously.
I remember now. You told me you've never met another Bowman's Wolf. Is there even another one in the star system?
No. The closest is about twenty light years away.
Well, that kind of limits your options.
Please. I'm going out with Winston because I like him, not because of lack of options.
Ever wonder if you were engineered to like humans?
If that's true, putting Dr. Bowman's brain design into robots is going to have some very interesting side effects.
I'm thinking long term here. Wouldn't it be better if there was a doggy daddy in the house?
Not really.
There are only fourteen of us. My kids are going to grow up with humans. It will be more important for them to understand human expressions and reactions than those of their own kind.
You are bein psychotically reasonable. I would be screaming and yelling if I were in your shoes.
Well, my feet are much smaller.
What is this?
Arrival Day. Also known as the day of the dead.
It's the anniversary of when our colony ship arrived here.
Mom, can I have a candy skull?
Not before dinner.
What's not to love about a celebration where you get to gnaw on bones?
Day of the dead. In reference to cold sleep not being one hundered percent reliable?
Yes. This is also a day of remembrance.
And by encouraging visits from the souls of the departed, it's a beacon home for those who passed away between the stars.
I thought spirits could follow helium trails through interstellar space.
Believe it or not, that's not explicitly listed in any major religious text.
Niomi. Hazel. Florence. Happy Arrival Day!
Hello Tangent. What do you have there?
It's a paper replica of me. If people can burn paper money and paper cars to send to dead humans, why not paper robots?
He thinks he found a loophole in the entry rules to the afterlife.
Soul or no soul, I've got eternity covered
I'm going to hate sending Tangent to the scrap yard. This last year, he's really started to show initiative.
He doesn't have to be scrapped.
Her can buy himself for his scrap valuue. Have him bring money and talk to the scrap yard robot. Afterwards he'll belong to himself.
You stinker! You HAVE been altering social structures on a planetary scale without me!
I'm just an observer on this one. I swear!
Ah, look at that tail go. You must see this Winston person.
Caught his scent. He's this way.
How good is that nose of yours?
Ever hear about people trying to train dogs to detect the onset of epileptic seizures?
You can smell my BRAIN?
Well, it's not like you guys wash it regularly.
Winston, I'd like you to meet my friend Niomi and her daughter Hazel. Hazel. Niomi. Winston.
Hello.
Mom! He doesn't have any hair! Not even nose hair like you and daddy.
He has spacer genes, Honey.
This is the fuzziest case of opposites attract that I've ever seen.
So, you two make an... interesting pair.
If you marry Ms. Doggy, can I have one of the puppies?
And that's my cue to exit before further embarrassment. You two have a good evening.
Puppies?
Aww. Kids are so cute when they're still young enough to believe all mammals have the same number of chromosomes.
Puppies?
Oh, no. Not for some time.
As a proof of concept, Ecosystems Unlimited didn't want a lot of Bowman's Wolves around. We're designed to reproduce very slowly.
Ghosts. Skeletons. Ghouls. Amateurs. If you realy want to scare a man, bring up babies on the second date.
This used to be a monster! He shouldn't be portrayed like this!
Just like Vlad the impaler. He was also a monster.
Then given distance and hundreds of years, look what happened to him.
I don't care. Hitler shouldn't be cute. And he DEFINITELY shouldn't sparcle!
It's good to smel... see you again.
It's good to see you, too. As for the graveyard, I wanted you to see some of our traditions.
There are a few changes compared to earth. For instance, Pan de los Muertos, Bread of the Dead, Is made from lichen instead of wheat.
I... really hope that smells good to humans.
Uhm, no. In fact, during the first few years, it was thought the bakers were trying to encourage cannibalism rather than prevent it.
Lichen bread! Are you going to eat that?
Here. All yours.
Thanks. Once you acquire the taste, it's really quite good. My family loves the stuff.
Honey, bring over our seven chubby kids! They're giving away lichen bread!
And thus we see evolution in action.
Another tradition. Two passes to Don Juan Tenorio.
Did you know a welding robot tried for the role of Doa Ins this year? The programmer did such a good job, they almost considered it for the part.
Why didn't they?
It had a plasma arc instead of lips. Their insurance wouldn't cover the love scene.
I thought this smart paper would ring or vibrate when I got close to an Ecosystem Unlimited employee.
Apparently the default setting is Origami.

1954.place: short time later, in the town/on the way to the theater

dialog.text: The guy we're looking for. Friend of yours?
No. He's an Ecosystems Unlimited employee. I've never met him before.
Which is a nice way of saying "I need to talk to someone before they break the planet".
That's him.
Thank you. I always have a hard time identifying someone from a photograph.
Good evening. May I please speak with you for a moment?
What the. Hey! You're one of ours, aren't you?
Yes. Bowman's Wolf. I'm Florence Ambrose.
Well, always happy to meet a satisfied customer. You are satisfied, right? Because I can't accept returns without a receipt.
Actually, she's the one who wanted to talk to you.
Oops. Sorry, I have to take this.
My problem is more people want my attention than I have attention to give.
I guess you can say I suffer from attention deficit disorder.
Sorry about that. Now, What did you want to say?
The robots from factory one, four and five are using Dr. Bowmans's neural architecture.
That design was for making colonists. They're undergoing a neural pruning around the age of twenty that brings them up to full human consciousness.
No worries. We have the situation under control.
I've seen your control. that's what has me worried.
All we're doing is a small tweak in the neural pruning program. Mr Ishiguro tells me it will help robots focus better on their jobs.
May I speak to Mr Ishiguro? The program I saw was more than a tweak.
He's currently in space helping to move the new moon into orbit. Mr. Kornada is handling his department until he gets back.
Have you met Mr. Kornada?
Yes. Hmm. Yes. It is possible we have a problem here.
Mr. Raibert. You're next!
This really isn't a good place to talk. Can you come by my office tomorrow at ten?
I can do that.
Excelent. You have my card. Need to go. Nice to have met you two. No worries, we'll get this sorted out. Bye.
Sam's methods keep working better than mine. I wonder if it's all right to be this happy while having a crisis of faith?
Sorry for the delay
We're good. Now, let me see if I understood what you and Mr. Raibert were saying.
The robots are using the same brain design as you have. Does that mean they're people?
They're as much people as I am.
You may want to rephrase that. For some folks, it will be easier to think of you as a non-person than the robots here as people.
Stop. Uhm. There's no dogs allowed in the play. Except for helper dogs. Is that a helper dog?
I'm here to help if he ever needs to know the difference between a Bosonic polariton and a Fermiotic polaron.
Uhm. Okay. I guess that counts. You can go in.
I wish they had quantum phisics helper dogs when I was in college.
Who were you waving to?
Ms. Ambrose. I don't think she saw me.
Don't you want a cell phone? Your communications are disabled. You won't be able to follow tweets or updates about the play.
I'm good.
I want to watch this play without distractions. The way people watched plays hundreds of years ago.
Luddite.
What did you think of the play?
It was a lot of fun. I loved the costumes.
Genetically, Don Juan did everything right. He slept with many women. He killed off his male rivals. Heaven and hell were used as allegory for whether or not society approved of his actions.
Sorry. Am I over analizing this?
You wouldn't be an engineer if you didn't.
Did the ending of the play seem like Deus ex Machina to you?
Qwerty! Dvorak! Were you at the play as well?
Yes. Top row. Explosive decompression section.
Winston, these are Qwerty and Dvorak They're friends of mine.
Are... are you guys the music dou Cyber Rap?
Told you we should have worn dark glasses.
Yes, we are Cyber Rap.
Great to meet you. Do you write your own songs or do you have a programmer?
We write a lot of our own music. We also cooperate with other humans and robots.
We're currently writting a ballet for some of the larger earth moving robots.
It will be the world's first combination of dance and terraforming.
We're calling it "making swan lake".
What does your owner think about this?
I think he'd be proud of us. Well, except for one tiny incident.
We did learn an important lesson.
No matter how much you miss your owner, it's considered bad form to dig up and motorize their corpse.
Which wouldn't have been so bad had mister "information wants to be free" kept his diagrams to himself.
But you must admit, that was the most memorable "day of the dead" celebration ever.
Sorry about your owner. It must be tough to be inmortal.
We're not immortal. Our neural nets are projected to last 60 to 80 years.
But can't you make copies of yourself?
A copy is not me. If I die, I'm just as dead whether a copy of me exists or not.
Besides, imagine if your copy got into the wrong hands.
We're talking a serious case of identity theft.
If a copy isn't the original, what do you think about the Star Treck teleporter?
Disintegrates the person on the pad. Dead. Creates a teleporter clone at the destination.
Do you suppose teleporter clones have souls?
I would think so.
With all those nearly identical copies being disintegrated, Star Treck heaven must be a very confusing place.
We should top off our batteries before heading home. There's a small cafe nearby. Would you like to come? They have coffee.
Why not? I've never been invited to coffee by a conscious machine before.
I'm not completely convinced we are.There is the "chinese room" argument when applied to microprocessors.
I might simply be imitating consciousness to such an extent that even I am not conscious of the fact that I am not conscious.
[The Joulery Box]
That is why it's called "Lost truck lake"
Oh, man! Your owner was a character. I wish I had known him.
It's the day of the dead. Our owner wanted peopleto remember him with happiness, not sadness.
That's the way I want to be remembered.
But so many of your inventions cause people to run screaming in terror.
Those can be happy memories... depending on which side of the terror you're on.
Good night. It was a pleasure meeting you.
Copy paste that. You two make a nice couple.
Speaking of which, do you still contact that interstellar probe with the big ramjet?
The occasional burst message. We don'ttalk much now that she's exceeded point nine lightspeed.
Too bad. She was cute.
Well, it's hard to mantain a long distance relationship once relativity comes into play.
I've never sat down and talked to robots before. After a while, you do start to see them as people.
Though as people go, they're kind of... kind of...
Nerds?
What were you expecting from minds designed by engineers?
Good point.
When did your owner realize you were smarter than the average dog?
He pretended to throw my ball. I fetched it.
I brought the imaginary ball back and pretended to drop it at his feet. Then I whuffed at him to pick it up and throw again.
After that, his mom would play with me. She appreciated that an imaginary ball doesn't get covered in real drool.
I don't think it's to disguise the scent. Wolves will go for the easy meal.
I think when deer smell wolves and carrion from the same direction, they think the wolves are scavenging and not hunting, so they become less alert.
I never really gave much thought to the benefits of rolling in dead animals.
It's a neglected area of study. I expect it will become more prestigious when Bowman's wolf researchers get intothe field.
How about clothes? When did you start wearing them?
Not counting the collar, about thirteen.
My hands developed first. I was able to handle buttons and zippers before I could walk any distance on my hind legs. It took a while for me to develop a good sense of balance.
Fashion sense, even longer.
What was your childhood like?
Pretty normal. School. Friends. Sports. Then my parents wanted to come here.
Back home, almost the whole system is explored and claimed. Here, not only is most of the planet unclaimed, there are moons, asteroids, even dwarf planets waiting.
You can homestand here. File a claim. Make some improvements. Presto. You are a landowner.
Which would be interesting news if I could own property rather than being property.
You tensed up for a moment. Is something wrong?
I can't homestand. Legaly I can't own property.
File anyway. things are a bit looser here. The worst that can happen is they'll say "no".
Well, I do have my own bank account here. that's something I couldn't have back home.
Of course, if I am successful, there's going to be a land rush as over four hundred and fifty million robots do the same thing. Perhaps the worst that can happen is they'll say "yes".
I looked up Bowman's wolves on the Ecosystems Unlimited site. It says you're human safe and direct order compliant. Can I give you direct orders?
No. My owner can give me direct orders. The mayor. Cerain positions in Ecosystems Unlimited. And civil servants in emergency situations.
So everything we do together is free will.
Good. It would be scary to have that kind of power over someone.
It would be even scarier to be with someone who wanted that kind of power.
Cover your intake ports
Knew I was coming in too fast. But you got your intake ports covered. right? No har done?
Sorry for the interruption, sir. Ms Ambrose. We have a situation that I am hoping you might assist us with.
In a very short time, two territories with over fifty thousand robots are going to go to war with each other.
That is one of the few things anyone could say that would refocus my attention after having a jet engine blowing sand up my dress.
I can't help with a war.
Both territories had their fusion reactors go down within five minutes of each other. A different vital part was damaged in each.
That's...
Each territory has the part the other needs. No spares. Also, there are no spares in the invenory system.
That's too many coincidences to be coincidence.
Which is why I need both a fussion engineer and a detective! Come on, Watson, come! The game is afoot!
Sorry. I wasn't expecting a robot conflict tonight.
Would you like me to come along?
I would love for you to come along.
Good idea. It will be greatly to our advantage to have a human along.
Sawtooth. For someone aspiring to be Sherlock Holmes, you are missing some major clues.
If we can get their reactors going, we can stop this war before it starts.
Dvorak told me a million robots are added every three months.
Robots need infrastructure. there should be several fusion reactors under construction that have the parts we need.
That... is a good idea.
It doesn't get listed on resumes, but being a good scrounge is a talent every technical employer looks for.
Since a human is with us, I've diverted a cargo carrier.
You diverted a cargo carrier for me?
Human desires take priority over robot needs.
That's ridiculous. What if a cargo carrier is needed to save hundreds of robots and a couple of humans want it to go to a birthday party?
human desires take priority. let them eat cake!
We're setting ourselves up for a revolution, aren't we?
No. More like waking up one morning to find all your workers have run off.
I haven't introduced myself. Sawtooth Rivergrinder, at your service.
Hi. Winston Thurmad.
Our first stop will be the reactor that is under construction. Please keep in mind that most robots there will be under three years old and have never seen a human before.
Don't worry. I won't do anything silly like claiming to be a god.
Good. Claiming to be a god would be to step away from being human. In their eyes, that would be a step down.
Welcome. I'm Bennie, this is my jet. Come on board.
Don't we have to go through security and get X-rayed or something?
Naaw. You blokes look okay to me.
If I'd known I could get on a plane with my dignity intact, I'd have flown cargo long ago.
All right, let's get you buckled down. I didn't come from the end of the world to your town to have you go sliding about my cargo hold.
As for you, sir, we have some seats up front.
And sorry for the delay, sir. Please keep in mind that most of my passengers arrive already packed in their own shipping containers.
Thanks for giving us a lift.
No worries. I know how much you love playing detective.
Besides, Sawtooth uses remotes and I own him runtime for helping me with a body image problem I was having.
Now I'm perfectly happy in identifying myself with the body my brain isn't in.
It's easy when dealing with one person. Things become more complex when two people are fighting over the remote.
That's your brain case?
Yep. Protable and lets me fly more than one plane. But me, the seat of my consciousness, sits right here behind my eyes.
No matter what plane I'm in, I remain the same. though I have misplaced the case a few times. Ever done something and wonder "where was my brain when I did that?"
Then I had a transmitter put in the case and never had to worry about losing my mind again.
The rest of us should have it so easy.
Sir, have you ever visited three year old robots before?
No. Will there be any danger?
no danger. For this robots, seeing their first human is going to be like their momma suddenly appeared from the sky. Everything's going to be rainbows and sunshine and happiness.
Up to the point, that is, when momma wants to leave.
Please keep these in your pocket, sir. Now, young robots are very affected by their primary programming.
In their minds, the greatest accomplishment anyone can do is successfully save a human from harm. they will be looking for any opportunity to carry out this action.
So when you're near that gentleman, don't make any sudden moves.
I'm off to plug myself in. If you need anything, just talk. I can hear you while flying.
Please stay seated until we reach match eight. Then continue to remain seated during deceleration.
And should there be an emergency, please don't scream. Emergencies are stressful enough without you guys panicking as well.
Sawtooth, get off my intercom.
What are you up to?
I need to fill out the forms to get the reactor parts we need.
I'm human. Won't the robots give me them if I ask?
To claim parts, even our creators need the proper paperwork.
Modern creators get no respect.
But they do get to use e-forms. If these were stone tablets, we'd both have hernias.
Black sky. We are at the apex of our flight. Beginning descent
Please feel free to use the airsickness bags under your seat. A friend of mine is collecting. She's going to make a comet.
Uhm, I gave at the office.
We feel fine, Bennie.
Understood. Beginning acrobatic maneuvers.
Rolling turn! loop! Snap roll!
Quit smiling! This is no fun if you guys are enjoying it!
Bennie, after we land and my accelerometers recalibrate, I'm going to step on your head!
Thank goodness for Sawtooth! immelman! Split S! Cuban eight!
We've landed. let's get those parts you need.
Quick stop, Sawtooth. I'm leaving you secured. You're going to have to wait to step on my head. But no worries, I'll make sure the next leg of the trip is interesting.
look Bennie! They have remotes here that I can access!
Okay, Okay! You win! no more acrobaticas for the rest of the trip!
Human! Human! Human! Human!
Florence, you have to see this. they're all out of the power plant and chanting at me.
Doggy!
Fame is fleeting.
Says you. I've just had ten thousand robots friend me on facebook.
Doggies have teeth.
Teeth are for biting.
Man bites dog is news. Dog bites man is not news.
Human in danger! Human in danger!
To be fair, I did warn you this could happen.
Don't bite, doggy!
Order in conflict! First priority!
Protect the human!
Stop! Halt! Desist!
I don't bite! Human safe! Uhm, helper dog! Helper dog!
Helper dogs are trained not to bite.
Human not in danger?
If you were in danger we would sacrifice ourselves to save you!
We love you, human!
Sorry. I didn't know my safety would be so dangerous to those around me.

tags: 4 spaces + "#" + space + 4 digit strip number --> Expected one line command
8 spaces + "*" + space + "#" + panel number --> Sets number of panel within the strip
9 spaces + "SFX:" --> Next line describes a sound effect
9 spaces + "{" + Text string + "}"  --> Description of character position within the comic panel (at the background, zoom,)
10 spaces + TextString + ":" --> Character name that is about to talk
10 spaces + "*" + Text string +"*" --> text string describes an action taking place
10 spaces + "(@" + Text string +"):" --> Who they are talking TO
10 spaces + "(" + Text string +"):" --> text string describes character action (like voice inflexion)
10 spaces + "+" + Text String + "+" --> Description of text written somewhere
10 spaces + "[" + Text string + "]" --> Text written at that somewhere
4 spaces + "Tags:" --> Everything are tags until valid next strip Number command is found

dialog.text: Maybe you should wait here while we get the parts.
I'm inclined to agree.
Yea! The human is staying with us!
With pricesses!
I should change professions. Winston Thurmad. Babysitting by the ton.

2001.place: >, At the power plant under construction

dialog.text: Read us this one! Read us this one!
Princess PID and the water reclamation system?
It's our favorite!
Once upon a time, there was a beautiful princess. Her skin was the finest titanium alloy, and her code was so elegant that she never wasted a clock cycle.
He tells the story very well.
If princess PID were male and human, I bet she'd sound just like him.

dialog.action: reading to a group of robots
dialog.text: And with regular maintinance, princess PID and the water reclamation system functioned properly even after. The end.
Another story! Tell us another story!
I'm sorry. Winston and I need to go. We have... other robots to visit.
Oh right. The war.
War!?!
Human in danger! Human in danger!
That's kind of why I was avoiding the "W" word.
There are no humans involved in this war. I'll be safe
Then stay with us!
I can't. I need to get on the airplane. I need to stop a war.
Airplanes fall down!
Human in danger!
Little help?
No worries, mate. Tou're not the first human I've had to rescue from overprotective three year olds.
Put on the gear I gave you. Cover your eyes, ears, forehead and mouth. This goes into your pocket.
Hug and spin. Walk to the plane, then have Ms. Ambrose come back with my transponder.

dialog.action: cueing for Bennie while Florence and Winston walk away
dialog.text: I want a hug!
Me too!
Hug me next!
Fly, you fools! I can't distract them with hugs forever!
This doesn't feel right. We're leaving three years old out here in the desert alone.
Are you thinking about adopting ten thousand baby robots?
Well, a house really isn't a home without the pitter patter of mechanical feet.

2006.place: >, Outside the power plant, walking for the plane

dialog.text: No. no. no. On the plane. Now give me the transponder.
You can't go around from site to site bringing entire robotic work forces home with you because they're cute.
That's how crazy cat ladies get started.
Last hug. Don't go, human! Stay with us!

dialog.action: Florence arives and handles Bennie his transponder
dialog.text: Don't go, human! Stay with us!
He's gone! That robot walked up, snapped to where the human was, and the human vanished!
Humans move in strange and misterious ways.
When I grow up, I'm going tobe a super hero! I'm going to be a robot with human powers!
Nuh uh! You gotta get bit by a radioactive upgrade or something before that will happen.

2008.place: >, Back at the power plant under construction

dialog.text: Good bye! Thanks for the parts!
Did you like the trick with the transponder? I picked that one up from Sawtooth.
Is that common knowlwdge now?
